8pnyh3jCe98GkfwVpqi-BA.text: Ok, this is not an ordinary airport restaurant. It's not the fastest service, but it is one of THE BEST fish tacos and the MOST INCREDIBLE green chili and cheese tamales I've ever had. And I've tried both at many, many restaurants. After spending 25 years living in Houston and traveling throughout the U.S. But since this restaurant is located in an airport most people enter with a bad attitude to begin with. The hassle of traveling, long lines, rude people...but people right next door to each other are two little gems in the Phoenix Sky Harbor Headache....Cartel Coffee and Sir Veza's Taco Garage.  Great sides also...guacamole, black beans and Spanish rice. Fish tacos available at breakfast too...big plus.

I_UcR2JtGwVebEIeuT38aw.text: The food was disgusting and it made me ill. Ordered eggs and they didn't even taste like eggs.

TZlGUtDt5mrdg5zoJY_2sg.text: This is a very poor representation of what an Arizona burrito should taste like. Places like this are the reason the people of California think their burritos are better. When in fact they are absolutely not better than a real Arizona burrito. I would rather have Taco Bell than eat a burrito here. But they have free refills on soft drinks. So I guess that's a plus.

btMeeOiLFTymiaiJo7ZcrA.text: Customer service manager is extremely rude! After ordering a burrito and a fountain soda I had taken just a couple of sips and got a horrible taste from the unfiltered water that was used for their sodas. It was overwhelmingly bad and frankly undrinkable. I politely went up to ask if the cost of the bottled sodas were the same price because I didn't care for the fountain sodas. I was immediately asked what was wrong and explained that I could tell the water for the fountain was simply tap water and not filtered. If it was going to be an issue I was willing to pay the difference however before I could explain this to the manager, he grabbed the drink from me and threw it in the garbage and said "Just grab whatever from the cooler I don't care".  F&B management is something I do and THIS is definitely not a job for this guy. Bare in mind, my flight was delayed 3 hours and if I can keep my composure, I'm sure after a hard day, this bearded manager can find a way to exercise his patience and utilize his manager and customer service skills. He is setting a horrible example for the younger employees on how to treat customers. Let this behavior slide and your business will have bigger problems on their hands.

jlK56cleqm64SQHTu-ytvg.text: If you eat vegan food and you're stuck at the airport this spot has a tamale with green chiles & corn, the cheese is on top so they can easily leave it off. They also have black bean and rice burritos and tacos.

JAcCSvAOF-7-GGdflrXW9g.text: We grabbed a bite before our flight, not knowing anything about the place. Mixed reviews.... the fish tacos were awesome! I really liked the overall flavor & how finely they shredded the cabbage. I am picky about my fish tacos.   The nachos were pretty bare & the chips were rubbery.   Would go back for the fish tacos, but that's all.

rIiFP8EtYWFgy---l0FacA.text: Sliders were crap... Tamale was dry and lacking flavor and the waitress was one of the rudest people Ive ever encountered at an airport

ReNtMcoYmVNt1NOcRiVTQQ.text: Horrible food and wayyyyyy overpriced, even for an airport. Horrible customer service. All the employees seemed angry. The guacamole was God awful!

Le9u1ZUtd10pzIQ6nTVwQw.text: Great airport spot. They serve you drinks in red Solo cups LOL. Wish it wasn't so packed, but I guess that's what happens when you have the best food and drank in the terminal #hype PS I'm the duchess

ijTyIcuIAK5wsHSOLaAYZQ.text: Extremely overpriced burritos that are small in size & have hardly any filling in them. $12 Carne Asada burrito that was mostly filled with black beans. It would take two burritos to constitute a meal. Complete rip-off, even for airport price-gouging.

pukQUFxvLdrXESLWmtgxMw.text: The servers are really nice and friendly, but when it comes to beer selection they don't have that much variety. They have a decent amount of beer somewhat. They only have one type of IPA beer though ):

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stuck in Arizona for an hour. Getting some IPA.

5OMxWcpZF2Ig7wae-1bNuQ.text: So loud and and uncomfortable. Extremely pricey and they give very little food. Def one of my worse airports breakfasts. Don't come here

CLdtPJ_wkFfj9XDRwrPQDw.text: Worst bar concept ever.  No matter what drink you order be prepared for it to come in a plastic red cup. The gimmick is wasteful and pointless.  The bar doesn't provide for recycling even though the hundreds of plastic cups it throws out everyday are marked for recycling.  This place needs to get over the "red cup" trend and get into the now.  Very disappointed in the cliche.  Thankfully there are a couple other more respectable bars just a five minute walk away.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red cups are so done... Where is my glass?!?!?

kzFlMnWFS080zmv2i_e7ZQ.text: This place was awful. Someone dumped a drink on me because they were wasted and this place continued to serve them. Because she's a woman. This place is sexist. I complained to manager which ignored me. I would never recommend this place.

7wdCgV9zs-7yiSZNpMKFdw.text: Actually didn't try the food. Stopped into to grab something to eat after a long day of travel. Bartender closing down his register,  kitchen was getting cleaned up, waitresses were closing out and and doing side work.  When I  asked if the restaurant is still open the rude bartender pointed at the gate across from me and said when that plane leaves they close.    I walked out of there, who wants to eat at a place that is 99 percent closed down and on top of that they weren't even inviting and said hey we're closing down but don't worry about it,  come on in and grab something we will take care of you.  Stay open till you close.

RIJp8IjeiCqYq73GgNYpcg.text: Ordered the fish tacos - should call it fish nugget.  For $9 - I got two bites of fish across two tacos.   Ridiculous.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Do you see the fish?  yeah that was it.

uj2nGxSPAV3kFZh5vGOlcA.text: Certainly in the top ten for airport food.  The food portions are generous, and while you're overpaying because it's an airport, it's not too ridiculous.  Service has always been fast and friendly for both food and drinks.  They have a pretty good selection of craft beers too.

jB667lpZUptDvGuAxKV1jw.text: If you ever find yourself waiting for your flight and you're 21, spend that time at Sir Vezas with a michelada. It's absolutely delicious! It's not a fully stocked bar but you can choose from beer, wine, margaritas and bloody mary's. Food was as good as bar food gets. I had a steak bowl that was almost as good as chipotle. New favorite airport spot :)

a_YNsCTbaadNmLm0tLGU5A.text: It's like a knock off chipotle but the food is disgusting. I got the chicken bowl. The rice was hard and the beans were cold . The chicken was flavorless . The beer was cold even tho it was served in a red solo cup. The staff was really nice tho which is why they got a star. Worst airport food I've ever had, and i travel a lot!

RDnjyT0sIAme--XXsaFKlw.text: Better than average airport food. I had breakfast tacos. I wish they had cooked the bacon more but I enjoyed the mix of flavors.   They serve a good beer selection in red solo cups. Also have PHX local beer Kilt Lifter

sAyX0Pq0rVyjExedAl_roQ.text: What do you say? Over priced airport food. The chicken burrito was dry. It only came with chicken rice and beans. No sauces.   We also ordered the 3 cheese quesadilla and that was pretty good but still it was $8. Over priced airport food.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken burrito

skOmgc3sdFS-wnBhDxArqQ.text: This spot was 15 feet away from the gate and I wanted a burger. I ordered the two sliders with fries. It was reasonably priced at $10.  The first thing I noticed was the burger meat was not made fresh. Even though it was good, I could tell that it was not made when I ordered it and when I opened up my container there were only about 14 french fries, I expected more. Even though I got gypped on the french fries, they were really good. Perfectly seasoned with salt and pepper.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Grz_dRxhfDUlKr8NL-JSqA.text: Absolutly discusting. Way over priced even for airport food. Staff was not very friendly and where just kind of hanging out.. Seating is tight and does not allow for any dinning enjoyment.. Had chicken quesadilli and chicken was hard and rubbery probably from being over cooked.. Choices are limited in this terminal, so if you have time maybe explore others.. Better yet, stop at subway and grab a sandwich for your bag..

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xCOQegwA2sSyuiS4PIbONA.text: Go to barrio queen instead. It's in the D gates. I love spicy food. When I get Mexican food I expect a reasonable amount of hot sauce. When I realized that my husband and I had only gotten 1 TINY container of hot sauce between our salad and burrito bowl I was concerned. I went back to ask for another and was informed even though I had ordered my salad without sour cream or cheese I had been given my allotted hot sauce and would have to go through the line again and pay for another tiny container of hot sauce.  Come on now, please. Service was deplorable. Stop at barrio queen in D gates and actually get good service and enjoy your food!

qsQh_jHsZnzg1j-ZQAU2eQ.text: Most don't go to the airport and expect great food or cheap drinks.  Even with lowered expectations this place fails to meet.  I have been to this airport several times, found several places that I would return without issues.   This one was not one of them.

XjvmXMtMsCmF9Och0I5Cig.text: Fish tacos were good. Better than I thought they would be too. I was really hungry and thought 2 wouldn't fill me up but I was full after the first one. Good service with friendly employees. Could've been cleaner, but overall ok. Floors n ended to be swept. It was want a busy time at all so people in and out shouldn't have mattered. I've been sitting here an hour and no one attempt s to clean the floor. I also had to clean my own table off before I sat down. There was a girl walking around with a towel but she wasn't cleaning the tables!

qojnucJMKlym8QMQiLPucQ.text: Not much to say except for almost no flavor chicken with edible black beans and pretty fluffy edible rice. The veg and onions are way too soft, almost mushy. The guac is edible and the pico de gallo did not look fresh. They also give you a side of spicy salsa that's full with preservatives.   Edible when you're on a bind.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meh

cMCMV-SDE6XFneJqPVdSPw.text: I travel often and I have grabbed a breakfast burrito on occasion. I have come to not expect to much from this place. The burrito is mediocre at best. The service at the counter is never good. These girls that work this counter seem to be complaining about something every time I come through. They stand around and have a sad look on their face every time I see them. Pathetic....

ICwPOYFBumwzQwruojNRsA.text: I got a vegetarian bowl, it was simple but actually pretty tasty. I'm giving them 2 stars because I hate styrofoam, and I think it's especially inappropriate if you're going to sell a "bowl." Styrofoam is toxic to us and the planet. If they rectify this they'd getmore stars from me, but I will never return to a restaurant that serves me in styrofoam.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JzQiFPvN-i8INXknJmmyww.text: Sirnoran Dog $8.95 Applewood bacon, 100% angus beef hot dog and old school fries.  Fries - crinkle cut and seasoned with salt & pepper   Dog - mayo mustard beans tomatoes , very delicious.  I also added green chile sauce and cut up that grilled pepper that was on the side.  Wow that was spicy, my lips are burning.    Awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sirnoran Dog

6gNNnVc3nnVT9JOp6IvNDg.text: We stopped at this place at the Phoenix airport. My wife wanted something to eat. She ordered a bowl with beans, scrambled eggs, chives and applewood bacon. It was very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V1F3pg71MIlo81ozjEE0Sw.text: Stopped by here for a beer while I waited for my flight. The staff is super friendly and are always there when you need something. As far as the food, its your typical taco shop in arizona, nothing amazing, but good (been to other locations). The thing that drops my review down is the unprofessionalism of the manager. I don't car what is happening you dont discipline your employees in front of customers. Yelling load enough for the whole place to hear for them to "find something to do", and saying "he knows he is mean so sorry". Dude you need to take a leadership or managment course. Other than that its a decent place to go.

N_AiXTMljl0w4FEZTEdeDQ.text: It was a horrible experience today. We couldn't get the food after waiting for 20 minutes when our flight started boarding. No one told us it would take that long. Several other people could not get there food in time either. Also, they could not refund us because the manager was busy in the kitchen. We ended with no food and no refund when boarding our flight.

MuZdgAB4KokCopbs_KN8rQ.text: This place is amazing for an airport eating spot. Cool vibe, friendly employees, but mostly good and reasonably-priced food. Don't they know they have us where they want us and are supposed to rip us off with high prices for marginal food? I guess these guys didn't get the memo and I'm glad. I always get the chicken bowl, but many things look really good. A big selection of craft beers on tap and flat screens seal the deal. Now I look forward to landing in Phoenix and long layovers don't even scare me anymore. Like most places in any airport the elbow room is a little close and cozy, but that just goes with the territory. Fly in when you get a chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice little Mexican joint... especially in an airport

Yb98N6phqhFIc1Gx-YB9BQ.text: I never mind having to wait at Sky Harbor Airport. The restaurants and bars are generally amaizing, except for Sir Vesas. I wanted to have my lunch till after i passed through security.  C18 is my gate. Although, living in Phoenix affords me great Mexican I have yet to get sick of good Mexican food. So when i ran across Sir Vesas i was excited. I ordered a carne asada salad. Wrong!. It was so disgusting. water on the  bottom, couldn't tell if the meat was chicken or beef. Gross!. I returned it with little push back. Got a fish taco instead. Again... gross! nothing authentic or good about this restaurant.  My advice... avoid it at all costs, the Zinc Brasserias customer service and food was much better.

Qx7owi-taQHPlWjgqx0IwA.text: Fish tacos from a tex-mex place IN AN AIRPORT?!?!  Call me desperate or call me calculated, but this place had some pretty darn good fish tacos!  Fresh tasting fish, tasty garnishes, and 4 flat screen TVs make this an ideal spot for me...and apparently a lot more people...the place was packed!  I was just tired of paying $15 for a $1.99 egg muffin style sandwich at SFO, so I held out until the flight landed in phoenix.  With a long layover and a growling stomach, I accepted the fact that I would need to eat somewhere...now I can't wait to come back!  Happy Eating!

vXjvSZYTuLUVPLrkaymG6A.text: So crowded, especially since people can only drink in the small space provided. The Phoenix airport (or the alcohol authorities) need to move into the 21st century and provide an area in the terminal for drinking, like Denver. Or just open up the whole terminal to drinking like Vegas. Anyone stuck in Phoenix needs a drink.   The queso was pretty awful. Don't get it. The taco salad was pretty good, though. But the fact that I had to eat it standing up while crammed onto a little corner of a table was kind of ridiculous. While some weirdo lectured this poor college student about how she won't be so idealistic when she grows up. Sigh.

fqrM-LCSZP3o54mRDhdFJg.text: Flight delayed and was super hungry, so I decided to eat here. Airport restaurant, didnt expect much. Cashier recommended carnitas tacos and I am so glad I got it. Is it overpriced at 12 dollars? Definitely. Was it delicious though? Yep! Being from California, I have had my fair share of Mexican food, and I would say the tacos I got definitely held it's own in terms of quality (but perhaps divide cost by 2)

mMURUvBj-W62QKI09SLBvQ.text: Food: bland, small and way overpriced. I had the beef burrito blah  Atmosphere: cool, but small. I usually walk by this place and it's packed, but probably because there are only a few chairs at the bar  Service: horrible. 8am in the morning, 4 girls working and none of them had a friendly attitude. I was at the cash register ready to order for 30 seconds waiting for the girls to finish their conversation. No apology, no good morning, nothing... The pick up girl was just as unfriendly. Called my number for pickup and not a word.  This was my first and last visit.

NpKkLPdprSoBf0J2F_g2jQ.text: Always stop by here for my Bloody Mary's before heading out to wherever I have to go. Great service and great food!

CpYxhIcmAs6KnooOyrSUVw.text: I stopped here for a quick lunch before a flight and was pleasantly surprised. The quality beats Chipotle. The bowl was fantastic, really hit the spot.

YtcdDVlAtlh8Nn5zszEWAw.text: Zero service. Food is given in take out containers. Nachos are served with fake cheese and they do not have jalapenos.

_Lq8-EqQwtqwuqHYZZ2s9g.text: Pricey but good. The sonoran hot dog was delicious. Taco salad also a good choice.

eV2sZNGrsqbOvzfJ8Spahg.text: the tortilla was undercooked, the potatoes were overcooked, the cheese was almost non-existent. the eggs tasted like they were from powder. and the whole thing cost about $4 more than such a small burrito should, even at the airport.

fTLiYvJQYwqJnkwxT17L3w.text: The girl working the register was too busy talking to her coworkers to get my order right or to remember to give me the soft drink I ordered, but the  Birria burrito I got instead of the breakfast burrito I ordered was awesome. Great food, poor service.

uKPH4CvjiuzoITMS3sA-VA.text: Don't go if you are vegan. I got the bowl and it was not very fresh and it was way too wet.

7k7TfS6HVVAlUIKe5MHgWQ.text: Not a good representation of Phoenix Mexican food. Chipotle and Baja Fresh have a big hand over Sir Veza when it comes to burrito bowls. The quickest way to judge a Mexican joint, how good are the chips and salsa. Chips stale and unsalted, salsa is processed and not fresh.

a93HCMDHM9hu8kpUpvSULw.text: Really excellent value for cost here, particularly for airport food. I ordered a breakfast bowl ($11) and easily could have shared with my spouse. It came with chips, black beans, eggs, green onions, green olives, chorizo (you select the meat you'd like) and a generous serving of sour cream and guacamole. My husband ordered the nachos - similar price, similar hefty toppings. The food was flavorful and mildly spicy. Again, better than a lot of airport food. The one drawback? There's not nearly enough seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast bowl with chorizo
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nachos
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oTky6avh975sevpy09clGg.text: Not a breakfast option. Bad seating (of course). Egg sliders made incorrectly, impossible to eat neatly which is key in an airplane it in a tiny crowded lounge area.  Amazingly overpriced. Sad.  More sad is there are no better options in terminal 4 C&D.

_EXN-yxFYOZA6Lz6m8LJrA.text: This is my go to spot to eat when I fly out of Phx, AZ. Its located by the gate so its real convenient. According to the other reviews I guess Im the only one who orders the cheeseburger sliders with fries and an Ice tea! Been here three time and haven't had a bad meal yet. The folks are very nice, you stand in line and they call you when its done. there is limited seating but i've always found a seat. or folks can go out into the seating area and eat as well. The sliders are cooked just right, not dry with just the right amount of greasiness! The fries are very crispy and not over salted, Plus they don't put pepper on them, don't like pepper on my fries. Just the right amount of food to make it to Atlanta! the price is a bit high but its an airport restaurant. What do you expect? Anyway I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. sliders and fries
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. scotty looks like a good selection of brew
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. great menu

2TWZ-K751S3djMkf_dpp5g.text: Bar staff was great, food was on par, and the beer selection was also pretty impressive for an airport. There are no dishes in the place and they assume all food is "to-go" so almost every order comes in a Styrofoam container which was somewhat off-putting.  If you're saving money on BOH staff, one would think you could splurge on containers that are biodegradable. Pricing here was good too, so maybe using these containers is an excuse to keep the prices low, who knows.  Ultimately, I dug this place, it's just too bad they can't take it easy on those Arizona landfills. As a native, I know this state is not very environmentally minded and accept that this is a typical practice of the area which makes me a little sad.

2y1k_9PulsHWkYGOPVmBZw.text: Actually good, but really quite expensive. Would love a more Chipotle style menu where you pick a base and select what you want. I came here while on Whole30 and basically got a slab of meat with salsa for $13. Not the best deal and would have loved some lettuce or vegetables or something like that. Other than that, a fair place for some decent food at the airport.   The main detraction from this place is the seating. It's really awkward and hard to walk around so don't sit here if you have a lot of luggage - you'll probably have to stand.

AxOdcjri7uZGUOJW59CgAw.text: If you are in the Phoenix airport there are some good food options, my favorite are the sit down places, but if I don't have a lot of time, I will come here. I get the bowl, they put this sauce on it that is really good! It's a "crema" :). I've not tried their tacos or other dishes, but it's pretty decent for airport food. I would caution against ordering the chicken, it's not the best chicken, I would try the pork, beef, etc.   I haven't tried the fish either, but they do have fish tacos.  Happy Airport Eating!

GBll31XsKZxNaqvbKKhuHg.text: When I travel to Phoenix for work I always make it a Point to allow enough time to get to Sir Veza's Taco Garage. This Place is Soooo Good I've even take Taco's Home on occasion. Honestly I found it hard to believe that this Place was only rated at 3 Stars? After reading some of the Reviews It was Clear that These People just don't know what to Order and Apparently have not ever eaten at a Airport and did not know that  Food is Expensive. I love the Design of the place and always enjoy drinking some of the local Craft beer available here. Also the service is always on Point! Thanks Guys, see you next week.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool Decor and Great Food.
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Concept!

naqWLwOp4r6UGC5llZqdIQ.text: This is one of those "if I could give it 0 stars..." reviews. To Cruella, or whatever your name was, it's not my fault the girl that took my order told me I could get the sliders wrapped in lettuce (instead of a bun). I even got charged for extra lettuce. I waited patiently for my food, got called up, and was given a burrito.   When I explained what I ordered, this extremely rude Phoenician said, in a snotty tone, "We don't make that." Uh, well perhaps you should tell the girl that took my order at YOUR "restaurant." She talked to me like it was my fault I dared order that. She then tersely says, "Do you want to order something else or do you want a refund?" I was like, "Hey, stop flirting, you're making me blush!" No, not really.  So I said to just do the sliders with the buns. She was multitasking spreading her sunshine to others, so I'm not sure if she heard me. She then walks away for 5-10 seconds, just leaving me at the counter alone. She finally comes back and says, "What do you want to do?" I'm thinking, "I'd like to recommend a career change, for one. It's not my fault you probably go to Arizona State and work at the airport in food service. How about something where you can scare children or don't have to deal with customers, like bomb diffuser. I think some Phoenix passengers would appreciate that." But I digress.  She was really rude. I went to McDonald's and got a lettuce wrapped QPC and it was delicious for half the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ha15COZI1iOYo-Moq8EGTQ.text: Airport Food - Always a challenge, and the Phoenix Airport Terminal 4 has so many choices. I usually have an hour layover between flights at this American Hub. It is good for me as I can get in a couple of miles walk and if timing is right, even a lunch. I had a couple of chicken tacos.  Simple enough. Very nice. They grilled the onions, peppers and chicken, ha a small cup of black beans and rice, and a spicy salsa. The tacos each had two tortillas, so I halved things and ended up with four tacos and they were all wonderful. This is my new go to place in the Phoenix Sky Harbor in Terminal 4 . Thank you Sir Veza

rRWwWh3m-FCx47ku9G6Jzw.text: As far as airport food goes, this is pretty daggone good  I've had the carnitas breakfast tacos (corn) twice and they are delish as well as great hangover food. It would be THAT much better if the salsa were fresh, but it's not terrible.   Prices are fair too. It's pretty filling - can't completely finish them - out the door it's about $12.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas breakfast tacos

WkOE1k7z9SMt125cBLn9dw.text: Had a few hour layover on Phoenix and decided to sit down at this airport eatery ....let me tell you I've been through a lot of airports and I have very little expectations when it comes to airport food but this place was absolutely awesome bye far some of the best airport food I have ever had hands down !! You have to try the Nitro Nachos !!

HRcKGPYFUNoE5y2GezJ0iw.text: I would eat here again! So, $18.95 for a chicken bowl, chips and fountain drink may seem a bit high, but it's about right for a quick airport stopover meal. I read the reviews before ordering, but took a chance anyway. I am so glad I did. Their chicken bowl is so much tastier than the big name National chain brand! Mine was minus the guacamole (on purpose) so I can't speak to that, but everything else was delish. The chips weren't really seasoned, but they were toasty warm and generous in proportion. So was the bowl. I couldn't eat it all and was super sad it wouldn't be next-day-leftovers. Not sure why this place is receiving less than 4 stars. I had quick service and tasty food. This is fast-food Tex-Mex kind of stuff folks. Don't expect gourmet at an airport! The biggest downside, and the reason this fast-food stop didn't get top honors, was the terrible lack of seating. I stood to eat. They have a seated bar and a couple of tables and it is packed! No real place nearby to have a table meal either. Keep that in mind if you order a bunch of sides!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken bowl, minus the salsa and guacamole. Pretty tasty! $18.95 with chips and a drink. (11.95 alone)

knLYeO3-W8m72MWrxP_MHQ.text: Gross! Last time it took 40 min to get my tacos and I didn't have time to eat them. This time I ordered a taco salad and it was disgusting an old. Nothing about it had anything to do with taco, no chips or shell. Will not give them a third chance.

9xnnbSnfAY9owJ77CMfy5g.text: Mediocre tacos and chips.  Pre-packaged salsa.  These guys sold out, original store used to be good years ago!

4q82aS4euxPDgvOKiEddkA.text: I got the veggie bowl and for the price there wasn't very much veggies, just a few droopy bell peppers, onions, and corn. The beans at the bottom were decent. There was too much sour cream. The guacamole was actually pretty good. It was pretty dirty and under the table I stepped on some old dropped food that stuck to my shoes. I think that airport restaurants should try a lot harder for their guaranteed customers.

DaEP9xqpATrVMa9MKPYpIA.text: Amazing service and great carne asada. I wish this was a restaurant I could go to at home. The service was great. The bartender tonight was super sweet and made sure the whole bar was taken care of. Cashier was also great!  Carne asada bowl was delicious. Meat was tender and flavors were great. Fantastic atmosphere for the World Series!

It405cXHHym0pnFNnfvHqQ.text: Stopped here today for a quick lunch during a 2-hour layover at PHX. I got a grilled chicken taco on a flour tortilla, minus the queso and beans, and a shredded beef taco on a corn tortilla. I had figured the corn one would be a hard shell but it was actually soft shell.   The tacos were pretty good, a little pricey (around $11-12) but that's typical for airport food. It has a limited seating area but I found a seat at the bar, there are a few tables to sit at as well.

2S5gtOJcOV29rZQ1LWh3DA.text: I should have stuck with a quesadilla but changed it to nachos. I kept eyeing the man's quesadilla next to me. I was tempted to offer a switch yet that would be an odd offering by a stranger.  The chips itself were fine. More on the thin, crisp side than the thicker crunch type of chip. I got 1 tablespoon of guac which was saddening. I got more sour cream than that. I'm not sure if they know what pico de gallo is because I had just diced tomatoes...no onion or cilantro which is another disappointment! ( i looked at old pics and it looked like they used to make pico de gallo w onion and cilantro...they may have forgot today) They also use cheese sauce. I don't mind it at baseball games but I love real melted cheese like they use on quesadillas. I opted for refried beans which were dry and likely canned..assuming by taste. The chicken did not taste seasoned and was fairly bland. Overall I wouldn't order again.   Next time I'm in the airport, I may try the brasserie..even though that's a few dollars more.

CrcVP3DIqu9o5Ki2quzPmQ.text: I have been a longtime patron of Sir Veza's Taco Garage; it is the only part of traveling that I enjoy. I looked forward to getting a breakfast burrito from Sir Veza's before jumping on a long flight across the country. Everything was great! Until I talked them up to my family and insisted we go get a breakfast burrito before a family vacation to Minnesota. I was so excited for them to try it. Well, my wife wasn't hungry, so she didn't order, just my brother and I ordered. The burritos came out astonishingly fast, as they usually do. My brother and I began devouring our burritos until after the second bite we looked at the now chewed off ends of the burrito. To our horror, we saw green eggs. Before you ask dear Yelpers, it was not St. Patrick's Day, and there was not a special Dr. Seuss promotion going on.   My brother was worried he would now get sick on our flight, and so was I. We googled what it meant to get green scrambled eggs and found a few answers. It was likely cooked at too high a temperature on an iron based cook top or pan. The combination of the two causes the yolks to oxidize and creates sulfur dioxide or iron oxide or something like that (go ask Bill Nye). It is perfectly safe to eat, though the sulfur laden fart smell is hard to choke down. We did not end up getting sick.   What has made me sick is the arduous process my wife has had to go through to get our refund processed. We were told by a "manager" that the refunds would go through in a couple days. We went on vacation for eight days and didn't think much about it. When we got back to Phoenix (late at night, after Sir Veza's was closed), the refund still hadn't processed. Now, we are talking ten or eleven dollars here. Not exactly breaking anyone's bank, but my wife and I try and live by some simple principles, and one is never to pay for something you didn't receive.  I called the store on July 13th, 2015 to ask about the refund. The manager I spoke with said she would look into the issue and call me back. No call on Tuesday. No call on Wednesday. So my wife called. She spoke to a woman named Maria who told her employee to say she wasn't there and to take a message (yes Maria, my wife could hear everything you were saying). Maria identified herself as the assistant manager.  Maria claimed that she called me and left a message, she did not. My wife asked to verify the phone number Maria had called (my wife is an indefatigable defender of truth and honesty) and the question was brushed aside almost expertly by the "assistant" manager. Maria tried hard to get out of having to do anything at all but agreed to call the district office. She would then call me the following day when the transaction was complete (I still have not received a phone call). Satisfied that we would finally get some justice (because we really could care less about $10/$11), My wife agreed to let bygones be bygones; but not before she asked if Maria had found that phone number she allegedly called and left a message for me. Remember my wife's tenacity? Maria blurted out a number that wasn't even close and kind of trailed off at the end. Do phone numbers now only have six digits?  There has been NO resolution. My wife called again today and found out from an ill-informed employee that Maria is, in fact, the GM of the area. We have been told that everything should be resolved today and that I will get a phone call when it has been submitted. I am not holding my breath. What's that saying? If a dog bites you once? Well... Hopefully, the same principle doesn't apply to green eggs or general managers named Maria...  I have nothing against Sir Veza's food despite my experience. I understand that mistakes happen and that being unreasonable about situations never helps get the results you want. My wife also understands this. In fact, she would tell you, despite all the pains, that Sir Veza's at Sky Harbor Airport makes the best Bloody Marry in Phoenix. We are simply upset that we have been brushed aside by this company's employees and management over a measly amount of money.  There was only one apology in this whole debacle that I am aware of. When the manager (it may have been Maria for all I know) originally tried to process the refund. She said, "Sorry... we just got new eggs". To which I thought, "Did we get the old ones then"?  So I, along with four of my colleagues and my brother, are swearing you off. It breaks my heart. Though, companies with terrible customer appreciation/service don't deserve our business. A little gratitude and sympathy could have gone a long way. A simple, "I'm sorry this has been such a difficult process" would have spoken volumes to their dedication to retaining a loyal customer base. Instead, we are all done with you. Well... except my wife, she is steadfast in her determination to get a refund. Also, she will be back for a Bloody Marry next time she travels. Seriously. They are that good.

dhxzwRI0cFkdMJaxVOG7oA.text: We ordered that carne asada burrito and grilled chicken bowl. The burrito was okay for airport fare although it would absolutely be a crime to purchase for $12 at an actual restaurant outside the airport. Their salsa come in sealed caps like taco bell and taco bell is definitely a better food place compared to this. The chicken bowl is the most repulsive thing I've put in my mouth as far as I can remember. It literally looks and taste like my puke after a long night of binge drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken puke bowl

xGW-pzEIlKOZ419SrgHg2A.text: The decor is like being inside you or your dad's (maybe your mom's) garage. It's self-aware (daydrinking headquarters). and the drinks take up an entire 8x15 in. menu. The happy hour snacks and drinks are great price. They really know how to make a margarita pair with a chimichanga. Want a giant, oversized margarita with 4 straws for you and your friends? Done. Bacon wrapped chimichanga bites and jicima maple syrup? Weird but delicious. Unique, fun  and tasty.

phKwLlvGoRxsq-M2FUAWpQ.text: Had a mimosa & Bloody Mary along with a breakfast burrito.  Service from the bar was great.  Burrito was ok, not bad.  Mimosa was good, Bloody Mary was not bad.  I didn't like the salt/spice rim that they used. Overall I'd come here again and sit at the bar

HEAvFHhUTY3qFyDlK5t2Pw.text: I had the most amazing fish tacos ever!! First off, they give you plenty of fish on your tacos unlike some places that get stingy with their fish.. They had lots of toppings on them, very flavorful... Probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had! As far as the atmosphere... I mean I'm eating at the one in the airport on my journey to Denver... It's not bad for what space they get to work with.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone flying or If there is another one is definitely come again!

P0wSjI1maIfXTayd5kzQEQ.text: I had a flight to SF that was departing from a gate near this place and wanted to grab a bite before I boarded. It looked like a cool place and offered some menu items that looked good. After browsing the menu, I ordered: Nitro Nachos, $8.95 yelp.com/biz_photos/sir-... yelp.com/biz_photos/sir-... Quesadilla, $6.95 + Peppers, $2 yelp.com/biz_photos/sir-... 1L Water, $3 The Nachos were pretty good, but messy. I had to eat 1/2 of the dish with a fork because the bottom half was soaked in Queso Cheese. I don't recommend ordering this to take on a plane....it's not plane friendly as you will get messy. The Quesadilla was very interesting. I ordered it with the Peppers, which was an additional $2....it actually came with Peppers & Onions. It tasted like an Italian Pepper & Onions Sandwich.....which was good, but unexpected. Overall, I thought the food was pretty good for airport food. Return Factor - 75%

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Opv0CyXdWKp7LnwOw9Hc_g.text: One of the few places open for breakfast at Sky Harbor at 5:00 am. Cashier barely said a word and looked like she'd rather be anywhere else. I understand it's 5:00 am but if you're in the service industry some actual pleasantries should be expected. Oh yeah the food is pretty sub-par. As one who travels frequently I've tried the sliders and burrito and had better stuff out of a microwave.

ERtBLRdMjtlCvTaq51wUdA.text: Let me start with the positive, cheap beer (for airports). It was about $5 for a craft 16oz beer, everywhere else is about $9 bucks.   The food on the other hand was pretty gross. I got the burrito bowl and it was dry and 95% rice with a few pieces of chicken and a very small amount of sour cream and guac. Been stuck in the airport for much longer than I expected and I decided to try this because of the reasonably priced beer. Next door is the paradise bread (panara bread for socal folks) go there for food, way better food and better prices.

ajE50oX1xo-06_jJxlIqrQ.text: $10 for a sad tiny bowl with extremely dry grilled chicken. Way overpriced and so not worth it. ):

yCnzMWVj8b8qM5BUieVpMQ.text: I had about an hour to spare between early morning flights at Skyharbor and so decided to try out a new place.  I ordered the turkey sausage sliders as I hadn't seen those on a menu before.  I think everything is cooked fresh and so it took a few minutes to prepare (which was fine for me, but if you have to catch a flight that might not be great).  The bread buns were nice a light/fluffy - perhaps like brioche - the turkey sausage was kind of flavourless, the egg "pancake" was terrible, like microwaved frozen eggs terrible I honestly thought it was a pancake at first until I looked at the menu again.  There was some cheese present, but it had no taste.  I added both the salsa they give you and some sriracha I asked for, but nothing could save the sliders.  There was a side of fried potatoes/papas but they were very small pieces and had been overcooked.  Based on this meal I would not eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey sausage breakfast sliders.

kyJQD-e3afx0eL-boeG_fw.text: I got the fish tacos here and they were excellent! Not sure about the rest of the menu, but looks like your basic run-of-the-mill TexMex joint.  Not bad for an airport, and right next to a fantastic coffee spot!

JAv35WJNpKxWf6m5CA00Qg.text: So so bad. Do not waste your time or money. Chips and queso... seems simple right? Nope. Chips were soft and moist, and the queso was some crap out of a jar that was just lightly melted over a few chips. Also ordered some drinks from the bar.  Margarita came without salt asked of i could get salt and the bartender responds with, did you ask for salt? Omg, really are you serious? The answer is yes, but even if i didn't why would you even ask me that? Then my beer had 2 inches of foam in leaving my 16 oz beer with about 11oz drinkable.  I don't normally rant on yelp, but I truly don't want anyone else to make the same mistake that we did this evening.  Make the walk to gate A11 and eat at taco Blanco's 4 stars Mexican at terminal 4.

vVcAZA4uDHwYkyRS2e2f0w.text: Very very little food given in the vegetable bowl. The container provided was less than half way full. I never write bad reviews but I think $10 for a snack is a bit much. Two stars given because service was quick and food was flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable bowl made vegan w/o sour cream, cheese &amp; chipotle sauce. Tasty but not worth it. Container is less than half way full.

MTh842O6jumv1Be9rDWAfA.text: Ordered a bean burrito, which says on the menu comes with beans, rice, and cheese. The not so friendly lady taking my order asked if I would like it plain. Unfortunately, my crazy mind assumed plain meant with nothing extra added.  I received my burrito with only beans, so I kindly went up to explain the situation to the girl who took my order. She said "you said you only wanted beans!" I replied "no you asked if I wanted it plain and I replied yes. I'm sorry for the miss understanding, but I'd like it with the rice and cheese please."  The cook quickly piped in "would you like me to make it extra special for him?"  Horrible, repulsive, inappropriate behavior. Never an apology and the food was ehhh.

v6zqyiIK29zfWrBURt4s3Q.text: Horrrible service. This IS an airport location so timelines is key. I just stood for ten minutes while the bartender was trying to teach Spanish to customers at bar. I was at an open seat and I didn't even get an acknowledgement that I was alive. Never ever will I go there again and I am here multiple times a week

zVQ0tZzBTF1EI5Fm4t87xA.text: I'm racing through the airport starving and hoping not to miss my flight.  For one time in my life I was happy my flight was delayed.  I had an extra hour and stumbled across this place. I ordered the carne asada burrito no rice, I honestly was expecting a not so good burrito because I'm in an airport.  I was wrong!  This place was fast, friendly and the meat in the burrito was amazing.  I ordered with hot sauce and it was kind of weak.  But overall really good quick food.

08kgW6UApMSOcZ35Joy5JQ.text: Pretty decent for airport food.  Quick and not bad.  Ordered combination tacos (you can mix and match) before a flight, they packed it really well - each taco was individually wrapped in a foam box and then a bag.  No messes here.  I ordered one chicken taco and one carnitas taco both in flour.  Chicken was tasty, good flavors, not dry.  The carnitas taco was greasy and not as flavorful - would not recommend.  They charged me an extra 50 cents for the combo.  Guacamole is an extra 75 cents.  Salsa verde comes with your order, but it's pre packaged and not fresh.    I didn't have time (and the real reason I had a morning flight) - or else it looked like a great place to drink prior to take off!

GeA_AT5-Ukx0gxgE13QzGg.text: Second time here with disappointment.  I've decided to write about it this time.  The counter clerks are gabbing and joking while food is ready from the kitchen, but it just sits there.    The sliders were as gross as they can get.  The texture was akin to boiled meat.  Maybe grill the meat or finish on an open flame? Duh.   If you've got a lot of time and not jumping on a flight, I would only then give it a try because you'll likely return your food.

7YAUPmNlaOUlCEDbdcLhXA.text: I needed a good breakfast while waiting for my flight. Enter Sir Vesa's! The breakfast tacos and breakfast scramble hit the spot. It wasn't fancy, but the no-nonsense breakfast is exactly what I needed. I'll remember this place the next time I'm in Sky Harbor.

7micmqDWSLaVD-d25hZDaQ.text: Grabbed the sliders, on the way to CO and they were great!  Such a pleasant surprise!  They were well priced at $10 for two, with fries.  The burgers were substantial, for sliders, well cooked and seasoned.   The fries were shoe strings and perfectly crunchy and salty.  Will stop by again when traveling next time!

AnF7L4Sc8HK17pgY105-Xg.text: For a reasonably cheap meal in an airport, Sir Veza's gets a FULL FIVE STARS. I had a DELICIOUS salad (hold the rice) that was seriously so good. I traveled for work for a bit of time, and airport food and I just don't love each other. I'm used to wilting lettuce on sandwiches, salads, and plates, and that's just disgusting but sadly expected in airport restaurants under $20/meal. Sir Veza's delivered. They have a small seating area, a quick line, free refills on fountain drinks if you stay in their area to eat, and a small bar with a handful of craft beers on top. If I visit PHX airport again, I'll definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vintage chopped salad

RXHkaIoIlp7lH7G30rOUgw.text: Wow.  Airport food that is delicious. Chicken tacos are my favorite as the hot salsa they provide is made with quality ingredients.    Definitely will visit the Chandler location soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A True place for a quick fiesta

02THofsruQmuVh-x8JHPEA.text: Ordered the loaded nitro nachos, add the meat.  It was loaded but very little nacho cheese. "If you want more cheese we charge extra."    The cheese could have only help cover up how stale the chips were.  Bartender was nice was the reason for the second star.

UEqP7PgRVFxmYigFnYbpgA.text: As far as airport eating goes this place is a constant 10/10! The staff is always friendly and extremely fast which is much appreciated always being in a rush in the airport.

kMVa-yjousO6vbavikffLg.text: I am a fan of the burritos here. It's great place to grab a bite inbetween flights. The burritos are always fresh tasting and delicious. You choice your filling and they do the rest. The salsa is really good here too.   The service is quick, friendly, and efficient and you can also order a beer here too, winning...  The seating can be tricky, as there is not much. However, with all patrons on the go, be patient, wait a few minutes, a table will most likely open up for you soon. There is also a counter to stand at to enjoy your meal here too, just another option.   I will keep coming back, you bet.

TWWfES0OS-GBrrHUyDEG0w.text: Don't.   Just don't. I rarely write a negative review, but this place really deserves one.  10AM on July 12.   Ordered the Stock Breakfast.    Very  cold potatoes.   Paper thin, tiny bacon, barely above room temperature.  ( Eggs were hot.)   Staff VERY aloof, not paying attention to me at all, even when taking my order.    No smiles....  staff as cold as the potatoes.   Lots of yawns and blank faces on the counter staff. Something has obviously demoralized everyone in this place.  Management better get on top of the underlying issue here.

q4oSEDlXx5B2bRMfPmCJvw.text: Awful! This is a $12 Asada bowl. About 75% beans. Even at the airport, I'd expect better. Better off at the grab n go...

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TUQ_Mo5u5Egpx0w-TOQRWw.text: Stopped by for a snack while on a layover at PHX airport. I ordered the Nitro Nachos with chicken and a refillable beverage. The total price was around $17. The nachos were good and enough to share. The cashier was friendly and told me that it was refillable. Only concern was the lack of seating. It is very cramp and not many places to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kV5v3xkhrvQi8MtQXd2rtg.text: Not bad for airport food. The hubs and I both had burritos. They were good sized. I had the carnitas one for $10.95. Hubs had the steak one for $1 more. Soft drinks include free refills. The only bad was some rice was a little hard and uncooked.

VlbQy-JC-N8-gFrMVo9Lug.text: After rushing to the airport and through security, we were starving while waiting for our flight.  Luckily, Sir Veza's was in our terminal. They were extremely busy, but it was worth the wait.  I got the veggie soft tacos, with 2 soft tortillas, black beans, rice, guacamole, and veggies. I don't know if my extreme hunger was factor or not, but these tacos were pretty darn delicious.  Like everything in the airport, they were over-priced, but when your options are limited and you didn't come prepared (like me), you'll gladly pay.    Order at the counter, try to find a seat, and listen for your order number to be called.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Soft Taco
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9-YxEqrfxxnKBJGrpmTSog.text: Super cute concept, good food but the front staff is very unapproachable. Both cashier's/ management are very unwelcoming. Very unpleasant attitudes which is dreadful. We as customers are all ready overly stressed over long flights and long lines at pre check out,  would really love to see a smile or two. I get it, some jobs are less fun than others, but a place can be distinguished by their customer service. This place lacks this. I would rather pay $11 to a friendly face, and let's be honest as  consumers were always looking for places that are more welcoming to spend our money at.   The food itself is great, btw: recommend the taco salad, its the best, and would like to thank the kitchen staff for being super fast and efficient, was able to board my flight on time. Other than that not a very pleasant experience.

-QAcXRQiMvAEftexN3ja7A.text: The food is delicious but the customer service not so much. The girl with long dark hair and glasses was extremely ignorant to us. We asked for a side of sour cream and she keep saying did you order it?I kept saying no I would like to now, and she kept giving an attitude.

7w_mbv_1Y2r6vIy-D4QQ4Q.text: The food was horrible.... the grilled chicken bowl was more like microwaved/boiled chicken.  Granted when you are in an airport you are a captive audience, but this was really bad.  In SkyHarbor stick with the national chains, don't get adventurous.

2Yu2fMq-sxXKCkBmy_1v6A.text: Our flight from Washington to Burbank had a layover at Phoenix.  I remembered going to Sir Veza's a little over a year ago and I really like their Chorizo burrito.  It was completely crowded so it took a while to get our food.  This time my daughter and I ordered the following:  Cheese quesadilla ($9): hardly any cheese but my daughter still said she liked it.   Combo Taco place ($12): I got the carnitas and birria taco and they were pretty good.  Lots of tender meat so it was good.    At least I know a decent and expensive place to eat at when I'm at the Phoenix Airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice and beans
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of guacamole
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas taco

QxnM8Ap7zNnRf2VnS0Oj-w.text: Awesome service, not so happy with the food.  I wouldn't say I'm a huge fan of Sir Veza's but I've been reasonably happy with what I've eaten at the restaurant in Chandler and the one in Tucson. But of course, just like other places that have gone into PHX lately, the airport incarnation fell short of the original. My husband got a burrito and customized it to be low carb (relatively speaking). They were willing to substitute the onions and peppers that come on the tacos in place of the rice and beans in the burrito, which was nice. However, they definitely did not add any extra meat and so the burrito was still pretty small and mostly tortilla. I also attempted to be healthy and ordered a taco salad which was anything but. Apparently they make it with a friend greasy flour tortilla smeared with refried beans at the bottom. Which wouldn't have been so bad if it wasn't for the fact that there was a woefully small amount of lettuce. And it was of the wilted iceberg variety. However, to their credit they did remember to leave off the sour cream so that was much appreciated.   The main reason they earned three stars was the staff. The woman who took our order was friendly, efficient, and helpful. Another girl was working hard to keep the place clean in spite of the crowds and even got me an ice tea refill. That was good since our flight departure ended up being delayed so I had plenty of time to drink it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tnL8-QqCaRO4qTDh0jOxYA.text: Wanted to pick up a quick bite before my flight and well...it definitely wasn't quick or worth it. I ordered a vegetarian bowl which was basically just beans rice, guacamole, sour cream and salsa. Came out to about $8.50. It was easy to place my order but I had to wait 13 minutes to receive it. The space is very small and crowded and there isn't really any place to stand and wait for your to go order. Talking to another customer, she seemed very frustrated at the wait time as well. I didn't notice until I got onto the plane that my rice was over cooked and hard which was disappointing but I was starving.  I was not a fan of my experience and the food was mediocre but it was convenient.   They do have a bar with tv's which a lot of people seemed to be utilizing because the football game was on. The staff was also friendly.

Gkqc9DvNJXiU82a2psg8wA.text: The fish tacos on flour tortillas were perfect. Probably one of the best I've had in a long while. Tortilla is fresh and fish is tender, hot, and delicious. I doubt you'll be disappointed.

2IqdFbCEfiG8iEddq5wSJQ.text: Got to this Taco Garage before a morning flight.  No line and I initially intended to grab a protein drink and yoghurt.  I saw breakbeat bowls on the menu so figured that would fit in my low carb diet.  The cashier asked if there anything I did NOT want in it from the list of options.  I asked for no carbs and no sour cream.  I was this expecting eggs, turkey sausage, cheese, black beans, jalapenos.  After waiting about 10 minutes I was given a large container with the above and 90% tortilla chips!  WTF and what a rip off since most of the container was the chips.  I picked out what I could. Check the picture attached.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Check out the tortilla chips in this breakfast bowl.  LOL  What a rip off.  Barely any protein but a container full of chips. SMH

ml3-b_SrezgdZXQwqfSoBA.text: $13 for a "bowl" - a teaspoon of rice and a huge glob of sour cream that barely covered the bottom of the container. When people say "airport food" this is what they mean.

qdpluuQ66lhSbuHfaJuXoA.text: I had some nachos at the airport before a flight with my son and the cheese sauce served with the chips was absolutely disgusting (and I recently tried Chipotle's new queso so I know the True meaning of abysmal). The Lays brand in the jar in the chip aisle in the grocery store is much, much better. Everyone sitting around us was complaining about their food and throwing it away uneaten. I don't know if this if normal for Sir Veza's or just the airport location but I never eat here again.

xF3Wg10wTEK_coDsM_l3Og.text: Bartender by the name of Giovanni greeted us with the worst customer service ever. We went to sit at the bar and have a couple drinks before our connection and we were greeted with " Just to let you folks know that if someone comes up and wants to drink I have to ask you to find another seat. " I looked at my husband very confused because that was our plan to get drinks.   So I looked at him and said what makes you think that's not what we were going to do? He said "I don't know what your plan is, I just have to tell you that."  My husband looks at him and says "I have never been greeted like that walking into a restaurant or up to a bar before."  He looked right at us and said "I'm sure the full service bar down the way would love to serve you guys".  I was completely dumbfounded as to what had just occurred. We had actually been to this same restaurant two nights ago while flying through and had great service and good food from a female bartender.  I said "we were just here two nights ago and had much better service." .  He said " well I wasn't here".  My husband looked right at him and said "no, no you weren't and we will be taking our business to that full service bar down the way just like you recommended, have a good night".   If there was a no star option trust me that is what it would get!

m7NMKH79hJhFz_20391-YA.text: I actually think the food is four stars based on the airport scale of jeebusi'vebeenpoisonedtellmyfamilyilovethem to prettygoodactuallyididntjustgoovermycaloriesfortheweekinoneday.   Just clean your tables and give us more seats. It's crowded like a frat party on a Friday night. Forfuxsake.

rE8uMjSRi8RQKN6nPEgYVg.text: Meh...Hungry at the Phoenix airport and they were playing the NBA finals...Why does "meh" airport food have to be sooo pricey?

l02aXCU12FHIbYg1URlbMg.text: Food was great.  I had chicken tacos, custom to my preferences.  It's a cramped restaurant so if you are just eating...go somewhere else. Michael is behind the bar and though I was not drinking he was still there for service.  Plus he's suprr personable and a nice guy. I'm a fan.

AerSCg23j_Gl-34QyYnNkg.text: Not bad in fact good. Great service at the bar. Good food, excellent beer selection. I enjoyed the time there with a beer and quesadillas - enjoyable. Keep it up a welcome addition to sky harbor

2FMsDS8k_zYBuEx2_0nW2A.text: Meh... Their quest takes like nacho cheese sauce you get at the ball park.   The chimi bites had the same cheese sauce in them, but with green chiles added.   And I'm not even a picky eater.  But they should market more towards a Wendy's or Burger King patron

3HbaYCVaVg9f1qib5EG30A.text: Affordable beer for an airport. The carnitas burrito was very filling and tasty. Definitely my favorite spot at Phx Sky Harbor airport!

x4HsimxV5wVBTOrABN7daQ.text: grilled fish tacos with shredded cabbage were quite good, for food in an airport..

lcNcu8PasN_ndxsAIoYQcg.text: Not the best food in the world but when your flight has been delayed and you're just about starving it does the job. Decent prices and pretty kick ass service. Geo and the team made my crappy day so much better.

98ut3ma87b-3gdiaY_Nk6A.text: Chicken burrito.  Chicken boiled more than grilled.  Strange mini rice, but had black beans.  Corona light on tap!

5jNLOpLy8ufHuB2tF25Nnw.text: We were at the mall and wanted to try something new so we stop into Sir Veza's.  We got a table very quickly, I think there staffing ratio was 3 to 1, perhaps training.  Although this didn't provide good service.   When ordering a beer say glass not pint the waitress didn't know what a pint was the size.  Also make sure you are very specific on your beer order otherwise you will get the wrong one (as I did).  We try a few appetizers, mistake the first was covered in cheese whiz with a dollop of sour cream, I thing there were French fry bit swimming in there but wasn't sure.  The Jalapeno chicken sliders weren't too bad, but the onion straws with them were under cooked (no crunch at all).  And because of our massive food order it took a while for the food to arrive at our table.  And even though this place had a whack of staff obtaining a refill of salsa or chips was not an easy task.  I would not go back.

Z6fcUaibTJE8dDIqmwhUvw.text: I had the chicken burrito. It was really dry and missing the Queso that it's advertised with. It's the only time I've eaten here, so maybe something else will be better. Just not that. The service was quick and price was moderate for an airport.

7apPxR_NWXtmNwaYS4nJ-Q.text: Had the chicken tacos. They were not your ordinary tacos which was a good thing. Very good taste and only about 9 bucks. Service was quick to. Recommended

iGfBoNWtMydCrvgLuZ_1YA.text: Got the bacon breakfast taco on a layover. Pretty odd and greasy-the tortilla was fried on the griddle, I believe. Definitely not a traditional breakfast taco, the salsa was closer to ketchup. I can't comment on the other food options, so the stars are for breakfast tacos only. The service was friendly, though.

rdaAOMURw02PHYidG56Cvw.text: I ordered the breakfast bowl with Applewood bacon and queso. I asked for no salsa, which they accommodated me on that. However, their chilaquilas (an ingredient in my bowl) is really enchilada sauce. In what world are those two the same thing? Chilaquilas is eggs, nacho chip strips, ranchero sauce and cheese. Since they soaked all of the chips in this enchilada sauce, the whole thin tasted horrible. The bacon was in whole slices rather than broken up - doesn't make sense for eating a bowl. They used green olives which I've NEVER had on Mexican food. I hate green olives and would have asked which kind they were had I thought they might something other than the traditional black olives. My husband did not like his breakfast tacos either. The only reason they are getting two stars is we've had good quesadillas here before.

xkoSboB63bVgo2CB0Jyzfg.text: Incredibly rude staff, heard them talking behind the counter about other customers; ordered a burrito bowl and was given an actual burrito, staff looked at me like I was crazy when I brought it back and said my order was wrong, then proceeded to talk to each other about it when I was standing right there. Too bad the customer service is awful because the food is actually not too bad.

ugN7juhbu3PnvW_uYVHfnA.text: Nice addition to the airport.  Carnitas tacos are the way to go.  Plus a nice pull up bar while waiting on a flight.  Don't forget the black beans & rice in the to go cup:)

vGnPNAJeVexGSnBO0o4GTw.text: I've searched long and hard to find good beer in terminal 4.  Santan Hopshock on tap, Four Peaks Hop Knot in cans, Sleepy Dog on tap.  Awesome!  And not 9 dollars!    4 stars because without having the food I can't give 5.

BRoB-_M7xorX7igcllp2gQ.text: I had a tortilla soup and it was salty , and a hair came free ( in the soup). Little pricer for a cup of soup compared to other items.

pvaLr6ObNNpJIJC1tkcisg.text: Fish tacos were pretty tasty but came with no sauce.  Asked for green salsa and got red.  Also, it was $24 for 4 tacos

a8u91rS8YuObyTCk0iGeKg.text: Pretty good for airport food! I had fish tacos and they were definitely fresh and tasted good. There was also a decent amount of fish in the tacos. I wish it came with guacamole though, that would have made them a lot better. Also, they're are a bit on the smaller side so if you're really hungry, one order may not suffice. Luckily, I only needed a light lunch, and these tacos hit the spot. I think the tacos have the least bang for your buck compared to the burritos or the bowls (I could get a lot more food at Chipotle for the cost of the two tacos I got), but I was really craving tacos so I went for it. However, I would come back if I was ever in Phoenix again.

chHbREU8T8Ydr8_pJ8BQqA.text: Good flavored tacos at a fair price for a airport food court. Fast service and a good selection of beer on tap.

UUmdRudXzYIS0OdJf8oslA.text: The shrimp tacos are the best ever! Great atmosphere and excellent service! Love the outside seating!

p-fFQwX7pBABAWTMCxly4A.text: It's so rare to get good airport food. My fish tacos here were delicious. Perfect portion and tasted so fresh. My husband had the nachos and he was happy too. Plus the fountain drinks are free refills and the staff were super nice!

Y6ydGFgma86oF53Pnu-qSA.text: Maybe I would rate it four stars if it was outside of the airport, but this is one of my favorite airport restaurants in the United states. Best fish tacos I've ever had, delicious tamales, and yummy churo bites. Definitely my go to place in terminal 4.

1nuiAuzAVBm64MHpzxfseA.text: They did it up on decorations, and the bartender, Natalie, was great.  Terrific for an airport bar.

ArJPI2qMFCy7R58Pn0HBQQ.text: This place sucks, shredded beef looks like it was soaking in water, it was bland, had to eat it with jalapenos just to get some taste, the tacos were weird looking and the nacho cheese was yucky not like the cheese in good Old San Antone. Will not return Hasta la Vista Baby

Y_IpEABW_dpFgfbN3g8kKQ.text: Passing through Phoenix airport and ordered a vegetarian bowl.  It cost more than $8 and I left a tip.  Opened the bowl to find about 1/3 cup of rice and 1/3 cup of black beans, plus a sprinkle of fajitas and a tablespoon of sour cream and tablespoon of guacamole.  In other words, it was very, very little food for the price I paid.  Also it was quite greasy and over-salted.    Airport food, sigh.

JFNPAV2FDCKtAwmH8_YGLg.text: Awesome fish tacos!! Best I've had since leaving San Diego! And the service was friendly and fast. I'll be back!

A0z_nogiFUi8QjCGYD_XkA.text: Waiting for my Southwest flight. Absolutely delicious and reasonably priced (especially for airport food). Good service and a fun atmosphere. Nothing like a Corona and a veggie bowl to relax before getting on the plane.

uQ8jHeam2msY-DIS9AeJWw.text: Took 15 minutes to get a chicken burrito, and there was no line. There were more people behind the counter than waiting for food. Seriously, this is way too slow for airport food. Food is only so-so - Chipotle is better (and way faster).

gJv-k5ljSsBm35IO6A5utg.text: Can only recommend this place for a great ice cold beer but nothing more. Had the Nitro Nachos...eek, me thinks not! Poor quality ingredients. If they mess up nachos with simple ingredients what other harm can they do w/ the rest of their menu. Restaurant its self needs a little sanitizing & sweeping. I would feel bad about the glass my beer came in but they serve in red solo cups. First time I'm happy to see them.

fnWAE-M6ZSSqGG_upNt19Q.text: Tasty and fast. What more do you need between flights? Decent, although not expansive, seating.

saBwn-75tV4twPW4dEvzCQ.text: Here today and was treated so rude by a 40 something male bartender.   What an idiot. Why are people mean?  There was not reason to be rude you could tell that he was often rude to people as other employee had their heads down. He was some type of manager probably sad about how his life turned out so he treats people rude because there is nowhere else to go in the airport.   If you can avoid it do not go here

rGC95bOTt81mirn99-TWAQ.text: Want to know how to gross a vegetarian out? Stick a big chunk of chicken in their vegan burrito bowl. Never again!

NUkoXo2rsi6Rz9AbI13Wtw.text: I stopped in here for a bite on 1/22/14 at 3:19PM and ended up ordering one beef and one chicken taco to go.  Both seemed to taste ok but a number of hours later I had a very bad case of food poisoning that lasted about 24 hours.  Anyone that has been sick from food this was about a 7 or 8 on a scale with 10 being the worst.  I'm just not sure which taco it was that got me sick but it was either the chicken or the beef.  Beef and chicken seemed cooked as I recall.  I went the through the airport recently again and asked a shoe shiner about this place and that person suggested that it is known "not good" by the people that work in the terminal.  I would avoid.

sVXnOhks54Blsf1RlAXknQ.text: We stopped in for a quick beer before our flight. The bar features a large beer selection at pretty reasonable prices. They were served in red solo cups, which was a little odd, but kind of fun at the same time. We ordered from the counter as the bar was full. The beers came quick and the staff was friendly. We didn't try the food, but it looked good and was reasonably priced. We will definitely be back.

7C-sL2xgmXgARoVZM38EUw.text: I waited for about 5 min at the bar which didn't even have a bartender behind it. When the bartender arrived, she pleasantly took my drink order, but then helped two ppl after me (poured a soda for a kid at the bar and then closed out a check). It's not like airport bars are amazing, but this level of service was pretty poor. Oh well, beer in hand now : )

BwuJzq2ts83V0wjLLgDIXw.text: Tortilla soup and tacos VERY cheesy and salty. The place was a mess, nobody seemed to be cleaning anything up except me. I can stand the high prices but the quality wasn't there. Would not return.

XMf71893MBeRLxRIi-yOZw.text: It's not the worst option for fast food style airport food. They have veggie tacos that provide reasonable portions and nice scoops of guacamole. The rice is awful and the salsa is more like pizza sauce. Although it's affordable and quick.

YBweRZZyPJddbaNYNnOYXw.text: The most bland carne asado burrito for $13, not even the sauce helped with the flavor

VEPD5D5QA4XJ_82DHBpQhw.text: Too much needless packaging!  I got a burrito and it was wrapped in foil then packed in a styrofoam box. Burrito was just ok for airport food but get your wasteful packaging act together.

lLicRdlnhnS7h2jbLKpVqA.text: Got the chicken tacos. Not impressed. 12 dollars for two (yes airport food) but definitely not worth the money. Staff was very nice. Would go with Panera if I'm ever in this part of the airport again, even though I can get that anytime.

ew1KJRk-yKbnahjZ0NPZ1g.text: The rice and beans tell you 100% that it's not authentic Mexican food. Tastes like Baja Fresh. Disappointing. No Aguas Frescas. Eating it because I'm hungry, but definitely wouldn't pick this again.

-tvYaMQxq1vtJR6-FwrmWA.text: Located near C11, you can eat at Sir Veza's at the few seats they have available or take it to go. They have breakfast burritos, meaty burritos and a vegetarian veggie burrito that can be made vegan if you ask them to leave the cheese off. You can also have rice bowls, chips, guac, queso, etc.   I have had the vegan veggie burrito twice now and it was consistently delicious. It has a lot of black beans so if you are sensitive to the effects of beans, just ask them to leave it off. Also in that burrito is rice, peppers, onions, corn and guac. Their salsas are prepackaged and both red and green are so delicious. They are considerably quick for food made to order so you can grab food in between flights.  The guacamole was delicious but I was not impressed with the chips. They did not have any seasoning or salt on them so they lacked flavor. I would definitely order the burrito again or a burrito bowl.

UcSh3HbdoU0VmeDDzy3WAQ.text: Had to throw away the sliders. Tasted unappetizing and like old grease.  Waste of money, an animal and food. Fries were OK.  The hot dog tasted old and appeared overly charred and to make sure the customer would be receiving consistancy,  the hot dog bun was also soggy.  Congratulations!

78bl4c8hOcXpj_CzvqZW9A.text: Not a great experience. Friendly cashier but the food comes out very slowly (20 minutes for a takeout order).  The carnitas bowl was not great (granted that I got it without onions and peppers and sour cream). The rice was undercooked (hard), the carnitas were neither crispy nor stewed well and too salty, and the salsa was packaged. It was at least half beans.  At least it was filling.

v6LSElRR2SDGyFucu4E_Rg.text: How do you run out of chips for the nacho's?? C'MON. The burger patties on the sliders looked so sad. Not impressed, I recommend you steer clear.

VrD1iGc6g7FMAU3CXLPgxw.text: Not worth it for the price. I ordered guacamole and chips for $8.25, and it was 1/4 cup of guacamole with about 40+ chips that went to the trash can. It wasn't a great appetizer, either. I was craving guacamole so I risked paying almost $10, and it was a mistake. Maybe their other items are worth the cost for the quality and quantity.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole for $8.25...

iBwsVnrCw_8GWyNu4iA53A.text: I was surprised by how much I liked Sir Veza's Taco Garage. While waiting for my connecting flight from SFO to IND, the Sky Harbor airport didn't seem to have many great options. For so many people on that busy day and in such a tiny airport, every food place seemed packed, including this one... but I followed my instincts and stood in line with my colleague.  Ordering took awhile, but everyone who works here is super friendly. I ended up getting the carnitas bowl. I took my box and found some seats at an adjacent gate since ours was too claustrophobic. With low expectations for airport food, I opened my box and my eyes widened. The juicy carnitas looked so delicious, smothered with vegetables and tons of sour cream, which is my Mexican food weakness. I inhaled the whole thing in less time than it took me to stand in line and get it.   Though I wouldn't pick this Mexican spot over ones in San Francisco or San Diego, it definitely exceeded my expectations for airport food. Sir Veza's also has a bar area, though it was too crowded to sit there. If I had more time, and if it wasn't first thing in the morning, I would have loved to enjoy a margarita during that layover.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carnitas Bowl

Uj_xhRIKZyLu8oivPz08Zg.text: I've been here more times than I'd like to admit, but there aren't too many places for a quick bite at these gates.  I've tried the tacos, burritos, burrito bowls and quesadilla, all of which were disappointing in one way or another.  I can't quite put my finger on why it's so bad though.  The meats are usually seasoned well, but everything has a weird mixture of stuff, like 3 different types of olives in a burrito.  I'm usually starving each time I've come here and still hated the food so that should tell you something.

3BqPDabxKj6rM_v1x1KMuQ.text: Here for a flight to SLC.... courteous and quick staff ....yummy breakfast bacon-egg- potato burrito and perfect mimosa to let me nap a bit on the flight!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

u8drfuytbYcGAKQlToMrkQ.text: The Sonoran hot dog was okay however mine was on the weak and empty side... see my picture. Hardly worth $10 for this... go get a real Sonoran hot dog for less that is more fulfilling.  Disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A little empty. Everyone at my table got the same and mine looked the worst and most empty... not with $10

XtMQha3GBm2xOq2mD_lqEA.text: We got the chips and queso! And we got the guacamole and chips! Sounds great right?!?! Nope... Never again! $15.00 later we got 2 boxes of chips, a tiny salsa cup of guac and nacho cheese drizzled on our chips.  Way to swindle your customers SirVeza's!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VzP2z0MrCrfaQhyXuFMnig.text: Overpriced airport food that is not authentic. But for what it's worth in a pinch its fine. I just found the pork burrito I had to be overly salty and didn't really have any flavor; the meat was dry, too.

o1SQSJuv59RU9NsOA_Zl-g.text: One doesn't expect too much from an airport eatery, but Sir Veza's Taco Garage is pretty darn good.  If you don't mind your tamales a little greasy, then you should give the corn and green chiles tamales a try.  Need something even simpler than that?  I enjoyed the beans and rice.  They're seasoned just right.  In short: if you're hungry in Terminal 4, pick this place.

8Xz4URx-SRD36snzqIWAzA.text: Some of the worst food I've had in a really long time, delivered with smarmy attitude. The gal behind the counter literally - I mean actually - tossed my food on the counter at me so it landed with a thud on the counter. Say whaaat?? This is how you deliver a meal to your customers? The message to me was "here's your *%*blanking*&%  food now get out." My "chicken bowl" consisted of Uncle Ben's rice - undercooked - with dry, pre-cooked, bland unseasoned chicken, brown guacamole and so much sour cream it was swimming. The "hot" salsa was tasteless and never mind trying any other salsa, they charge extra for that. I despise restaurants that charge extra for essentials like sauces. I ate 3 bites b/c I was absolutely starving then threw it away, wrote this review, and then went next door to Panera, like I should have in the first place, for something edible. There are a few good things about Sir Veza's: a bar (which may be how you're able too eat the food) and free refills on fountain drinks.  Poor quality food served by people who really don't want to be there = my experience. What a waste of $15.96

N4mrtvDIFy8Mgqf1OvD1LA.text: I came here during a layover. The staff was super friendly. I ordered the vintage chopped salad with chicken. It came out quick. The portion size was good, ingredients were fresh, and everything was seasoned really well/ good flavor. It also wasn't very expensive (for an airport). Glad I chose to stop in!

n9TiS2kza97NHbxTEd06vw.text: Airport food is what it is, but the service was really subpar and not helpful at all. They advertise gluten-free options, but everything is cross contaminated that they advertise as "GF". I asked for shredded cheese instead of queso, and they still put queso on the burrito bowl.

v26nW9ntiMXaKJxjwTfIbA.text: Quick and friendly service on a very busy morning at the Phoenix airport! There are a lot of tasty options. I had the black bean breakfast bowl. It was hard to choose because I wanted a few different items. The bowl was pretty great-especially for fast airport food. I also loved the coffee!   There isn't a lot of seating so you may have to stand or take it to go if it's a busy airport day!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast black bean bowl
