XZP_TGW7saHHB6YkfJYvYQ.text: We went here for convenience. Good for airport food. Tacos, burritos or bowls. Comes with a variety of ingredients and choice of protein. You pay up front at the register, then they prepare your food in a to-go box to eat in their small restaurant seating area or take with you to your gate.   We got the beef bowl. Came with a good amount of rice, beans, meat, cheese, sour cream, salsa and even guacamole without extra charge. The portion size was good compared to the price of other restaurants at the airport.   For what it was, airport food, it was decently priced, fast and tasted pretty good. Nothing to rant and rave about, but we were satisfied.

9nqQmjdmWhGXfPBPxOz45Q.text: I dont expect much from airport food but REALLY?   Slider was terrible, 14 french fries  to go along with this Dry meal!    Nachos were bland at best.   Rather have hit up McDonald's!!!

93F7H1hUKCgPjofnUJbUHA.text: Huge portions and tasty stuff. Trust the bartender, she knows what to recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3_NQa4csgLSnsQQ7MktFHQ.text: Needed to grab something eat before I hopped on my flight but wanted something other than pizza or a pre-wrapped sandwich. Stumbled upon this little place and ordered the Chicken & Bacon Quesadilla. Great flavor and the perfect size. Came with just the right amount of guacamole. Overpriced but that's what you get when ordering food in the airport. Definitely would come back next time I'm in Phoenix's airport.

E_Jmc42oL4PzheINuI-RMA.text: Wow. Best airport food I've ever had. Had carnitas breakfast tacos on corn tortillas and they were absolutely delicious. Breakfast potatoes were kinda tasteless but tacos were excellent. Great mimosa too. Glad I was able to get one last mexican meal before heading back to the east coast.

0wSqZ47cdIzXuJkxsQO_Rw.text: Decent food but a LONG wait! Avoid this place unless you have a lot of time in the airport! It took me about 30 minutes to get my food and they didn't even start half my order until I complained after 20 minutes! The other half of my order sat on the counter for 10 minutes getting cold!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Decent food but a LONG wait!

rAqjSoT4ueY-gaGOAwJHig.text: Great margaritas,  amazing fish tacos, and quick service for the experienced traveler.

y9f4_vkEdOj0QKRed5E8Tw.text: I walked all the way to the C terminal to try this place out. My flight was out of the B terminal. Staff was nice and sweet. I had the chicken tacos and a local brew. Tortillas were soft but the filling was delish'

U1gGtHpCB-qWjxnfnS6BXA.text: Decent burrito, for an airport. Barbacoa was actually pretty tasty but the size left me wanting more to eat.

fFN6nJxiQmnXUvdGLV2HOA.text: Second time we ate here at Chandler mall.  The service sucks and the food is worse. I don't think this place will last long. Even the manager comped us drinks because the food was so bad and the servers kept walking by.  What a dump!

Wz9EwN3pN2984h9vDpLXmw.text: I've had two meals here, both were tasty. They clearly label their menu indicating gluten-free options. As GF people know, most Mexican food is naturally GF.  But it's nice to know that the kitchen is attempting to eliminate contamination. The location is right next door to Cartel Coffee by the high C gates. They have a seating area and a TV. Carry out business is pretty quick. The salsa comes on the side in containers, red and green. Burrito bowl was flavorful and a good portion size for me.

vZQ4km6qv1nFEF37pk10WQ.text: Staff unpleasant and dismissive.  Food awful.  I travel through Phoenix often, will never again pay for the overpriced "food" again.

AsEGma5R178STiGZ0kUCrg.text: Pretty good Mexican joint, Arizona-style. Definitely recommend if you're stuck by a delayed flight. Great service and free refills.

hL5WKw_vxbR6q3IaQFCQow.text: Came here between flights. Not a bad place to hang out and have a beer, but $10 for a burrito that only has beans, rice and meat? Not worth the money spend for food. Come catch a game between flights and a beer, thats about it.

anPUIkh4ApNU2gJte96V6w.text: One of the worst dining experience I can recall. I had burger sliders. Had to come out of a microwave. Some of the fries we under cooked and some overcooked. My wife had a quesadilla that was average at best.

E3AQp0UyMwwN9YYf-hCDNg.text: I'm sitting a couple of feet away from Sir Veza's as I wait for my flight to board. I had some time to kill and was very interested in a drink and at this gate Sir Veza's satisfied both of those requirements. Their menu is simple, I ordered a burrito with grilled chicken and a "sky harborita". Their layout is kind of weird because anywhere you stand to wait for your food and drink will be blocking either people getting drinks at the bar or people behind you waiting to order.   Anywho, I got my burrito and drink and after a few minutes snagged a seat at a table. The harborita did it's job for $5 and the burrito was actually pretty good. Black beans, cheese, rice, meat, and a side of chile verde which was flavorful and I'm glad I dipped my burrito in it. If the burrito ($7.95) were a dollar cheaper or a little bigger, I probably would have no complaints. This is a pretty good joint and would eat here again

E2HD2CmgoaKSOwVxbpXqXA.text: Staff was super friendly.  Ordered the Burrito bowl.  Ugh.  Seriously gross.  I LOV E  Mexican food and will eat ANYTHING.  This was just bad.  Granted, a bit late at night but please do not scrape up the crusty rice that has been in the pot all day and add it to the meal - and sauce wayyy too salty.  But hey, there are no options.  If you have an option, take the drinks, skip the food.

uUhg4X64Ha7EHBiUVJXdsA.text: This was closest to my gate..and i was feeling hungry..so why not..  I got the overpriced 2 carnitas tacos... Not legit at all..  It was just eh.....

pfZVh8DnfnDnfzafcBsZSg.text: The young woman who took my order never smiled and acted like she was in pain.   My chicken tacos were cold.   When I requested replacements, the guy was incredibly rude. First, again - no smiling and no apology. He tried to argue with me that the small amount of sauce cooled them down. He realized I wasn't going to argue with him. So I looked up at the menu to remind myself what I didn't want on the tacos, he said to me, "look at me!"   After I got the warm tacos, I told him I thought they should smile some and he wanted to argue again. Nope.   The food was edible, but you couldn't pay me to eat there again.

2P2h9yw8XfbhwIdKf_tNXg.text: We had a layover and looked forward to a nice cup of soup while waiting. What we got was a salt lick of tortilla soup and when we attempted to alert the counter server, Trisha, of our dislike, we were dished up a huge helping of bad attitude. Total rudeness topped with no eye contact.  This was not at all what we expected. What happened to service with a smile?  We cannot recommend Sir Veza's to any future terminal 4 visitors.

EFN5WLfWZZw8CaEnFYzFmg.text: Stopped here before boarding onto my flight. As far as options it's either Sir Veza or Panera for eateries by gates 11-19 (I think, don't quote me). I was a little hesitant as some Yelpers reviews were mixed and I was on a time crunch. I ordered a chicken quesadilla since I'm on a long flight and don't want to take any risks.   My ordered seemed to be out pretty quickly given the line and how busy it was. It seems as all of their meals are brought out in to go containers/packaging and I appreciate that as I finished eating my food on the go.   I was pleasantly surprised as some said the food was bland. My quesadilla was freshly made and the chicken was so yummy! I was expecting gross/dry chicken but instead got fresh savory chicken which made it that much better. The quesadilla was served with fresh guacamole and cheese. I don't know if that is included or if I was charged extra but if I was, I'm totally ok with it because I love guacamole and I was in a hurry.   Overall, I would recommend this place for a quick bite. Yes it's airport grade pricing but overall I've had worse. I can't speak for the other menu items but I'd definitely come back as I know what to expect!

n_ehugJxwiavkO4eUH9h0g.text: This place was a disappointment. My daughters kids burrito was incredibly small. When you buy a burrito you never expect to be hungry afterwards. She is 7 and the burrito was smaller than her hand. I've never seen anything so small. Ridiculous.   The carnitas burrito that I bought was largely flavorless, with one of the dominant flavors being instant rice (like uncle Ben's you might have had at a school cafeteria in 1985). The beans were undercooked. When you are so close to Mexico and you can't make a passable burrito, you are doing it on purpose. This establishment has decided to make gross Mexican food. Sacrilege!  They also ran out of chips. How does an establishment let themselves run out of a largely imperishable staple food that everyone wants is a sign that it's poorly managed. Please don't eat at this place unless you really enjoy the flavor Uncle Ben's style rice at the forefront of your eating experience. Epic disappointment:-(

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iEI4DSJ2_erDnyzdPH2urw.text: so many plastic solo cups and so little time.   #college #reviewsarecool

GyzHss_Jpa1dB32d5lxlSQ.text: This place is horrible. All the food items come out of bags and are microwaved. The house margarita cost $14.12 and it's premixed and the tequila in it is the worst stuff you could possible put in your body. Might as well be rubbing alcohol. It's called Juarez. and don't bother with the premixed patron marg because there's barley any alcohol mixed in. You'll be sure to have fruit flys in and on your drink the entire time because the bar is infested with them.  Hope you don't make a spill because once they take out the mop my god does it smell disgusting..as if there mops have never been changed. They clean it in the sinks they do the food dishes in  I've seen employees through the kitchen window not wearing gloves when taking quesadillas out of the grill and wrapping burritos without gloves.   I've killed cockroaches in there before. Ew.  This place is nasty!! Good luck!!  Oh and look at all the dust caked everywhere!! On the garage door and any prop that's in there for decoration. If you sit at the bar the dust is just flying around in your food and cups

ma4b2Nhn0DIlG_KZkdtMIA.text: Great airport food! Quesadilla with chicken and bacon and chips and guac. House made chips still warm. House margarita was strong and solid. Service was fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1_vlIhm4sbEek3eNy-u4FQ.text: I stopped by for a quick bite and margarita before my flight. The total cost was around $21 for a quesadilla and margarita, which is to be expected at an airport. The service was quick and the bartender was attentive. This will for sure be one of my pre-flight stops moving forward!  Try the chicken and bacon quesadilla. Soooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tons of tap options.
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Marg!!
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Neat decor!

uGVKRY6PKt7T9NyvO3FqYw.text: As noted in the photo of my burrito picture before I dug-in, the salsa they serve at Sir Veza's Taco Garage, is packaged.  It was, however, tasty enough to ask for a second serving of it.  That being said, nothing about this place is authentic... it's decent food considering the other airport options, but nothing I'd seek out if I wasn't catching a flight at a gate close by!  I had a burrito with chicken and veggies and it filled my belly for my flight and the night.  Again, it's 3 stars, but nothing to go out of your way for if you have other options that sound appealing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not so excited about the packaged salsa...hoping it Tate&#39;s more like homemade!

qIn7qEvp4VfndzOhln6hOQ.text: This was my usual stop prior to trips. Last few times was just awful. I'm not sure what they have done to the food and service (what service?) but what a drastic change. Yuck. Can't remember what exactly a margarita used to cost but I'm pretty sure it was raised by at least $5.00 overnight. And where are the regular bartenders??. Just keep walking.....

NDv9hEtr13ebFZpChMOoKg.text: Any joint that exclusively uses single use plastic service setups is a single use joint. The food was ok, way overpriced (but to be expected in an airport behind the security checkpoint), service was expedient, vibe was good if not funky. The reason I implore you to avoid this place was the clamshell container, cup, condiment container, utensils the food was served in were all SUP.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Any joint that exclusively uses single use plastic is a single use joint.

BGvHbdpslnt0da4t_B0FjQ.text: I stopped for dinner and preboarding beer, and was quite satisfied! The place is small so crowded, but service is quick and food is great! I had a chicken quesadilla with peppers and onions, and a Shock Top. The bartender was friendly and even grabbed my food for me when it was ready as I sat at the bar. The only thing that would make this place better is if it had more seating, and maybe mushrooms as an optional add-in!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shock top
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken quesadilla

jOzs8ucnSiYcj8enl0XNFg.text: Let me start by saying the food was great but a bit overpriced like all the rest of the airport. Service was polite and quick. That being said... in a day and age where it isn't appropriate to address someone with he or she as a pronoun because we may hurt someone's feelings, why is it ok to post vulgar stickers (with a prominent f word) proudly on display for all to see, including children.  I'm not about political correctness but why do you have to shove this in our faces.  God forbid someone might be offended by your censorship of fowl language.  Is this the image you want to put forward?  It's an airport, open for all to see that walk by. It's not like it's on the wall in a bar.  We'll see if you care, and remove the stickers.  See attached pics

9lJE9Pj2Panjk6PzLGb3Xw.text: An average airport food joint to grab a quick bite to eat between flights or during a long layover. Obviously, not the best Mexican food you are ever going to find (come on people, it's an airport).   The service was fast and friendly. The prices for the portion size were fair - again, taking into consideration that you are stuck in an airport and they can basically charge whatever they want.   I've had a few different items from Sir Veza's over time and throughout many travels. On my most recent trip, I ordered the carnitas breakfast burrito. Nothing to rave about, but it filled my stomach, didn't make me sick, and kept me full until I got to my destination.

RHuWoPrHEfJD_SQn8WCAQA.text: Waking up super early, catching a 6am flight and starving! I'm sooo happy this place is open so early! Both places on either sides were open but with limited menu, and only serving coffee, pastries and cold items. I wanted a good breakfast. Sir Veza's was open early and with full breakfast menu of super yummy hot food! Yum! And the staff was nice and friendly so early in the AM. I had the egg and turkey sausage breakfast bowl. Super good and pretty big. Airport prices as usual but definitely worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg &amp; turkey sausage breakfast Mexican bowl, yum!!

SkxGcxzLT7qC0Lyfr6bHLQ.text: Stopped by to get a breakfast burrito before our flight leaving Phoenix. Quick service which is important at an airport!  I got a bacon one - it was filled with eggs, bacon, potatoes and cheese and it was a good tortilla. The salsa they give you is really good, I tried both the red and green.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wGo3zuOuPedUkRX7_sYRqw.text: There are not good eating options in these gates, period. I stopped here because it was close to my gate and honestly the nearby Paradise bakery is crappy too.   They advertise hard that they're the "spot for day drinking" so if an adult beverage appeals to you at 8am on a Tuesday, well good for you I guess. I opted for a turkey sausage burrito which was like $11.   I received an incorrect order to start (bacon and something else) and the remake was terrible. Barely lukewarm, and bad quality ingredients. You know the "free hotel breakfast" quality? Yeah, take those powdered eggs, sketchy sausage and wrap that shit in a tortilla and charge people $11.   Cashiers were not especially pleasant and rather snotty about a remake, requiring my receipt to be produced. If you're hungry there are few options nearby and all are terrible. Choose whatever you think will make you the least frustrated.

bVmG1p0T4cJ80je7kv_iiw.text: PHX airport leadership. Most national airports have been upping the food quality, yet Phoenix chooses to remain the same. The C terminal restaurant options are slim.  SirVeza's was my last chance for a snack. I wanted one taco ala carte (I don't think the cashier knows the meaning) and was told no. So instead I had gas station chips and queso.  My observation is they have a lackluster, unengaged staff, just going through the motions.  The furniture (pleather couch) is beat to hell with exposed foam. Haha. Like a college friend's house.  Next time, I'll pass and buy a bag of chips.

PJgH8yvo9mjvjEy7va-4Kw.text: Had the grilled chicken black bean bowl. Large amount meat, veggies, and nice amount of rice for $12.99. Has limited seating in the restaurant as is the case for most airport restaurants. Service was prompt given the long line waiting for service. Flavor profile was a pleasing medium spice with creamy sauce and cheese to take the edge off the bite.  Above average for airport food.

xNqyVT8yaDsJjHExnwkaeQ.text: Pretty good place to eat and grab a drink while you're waiting on your flight. They have s pretty good menu selection and their prices are pretty reasonable as well. They have limited seating and it does get pretty busy. We had the sliders and fries. The fries were excellent as they were the krinkle fries and the sliders were decent. They only come with cheese and thousand island dressing (- 2 Stars) which I didn't get, but I added mustard to mine. The wine cups are plastic and the beer cups are the red dixie cups. The decor is pretty cool. The staff was very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cabernet for me and Beer for my son - Love the simple cups !!!
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders and fries (comes with cheese and 1,000 Islands, no dressing), added mustard - Very Good
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the decor

yon5e7rakvlC-36pl-Uypg.text: This place is exactly what u need it to be.  Small bar but I got a spot and had a great time eating a delish chicken quesadilla and having a couple Modelos while watching golf.  I love watching golf.  Hannah is super sweet and attentive.  I will be back!

G1P876gO6l8ad6_J6bFRvQ.text: The fact that this place uses an OBSCENE amount of red solo cups and styrofoam is reason enough for me to never return. They literally serve all drinks in red Solo cups. I even asked for a bottled beer to avoid it and they refused. They'll use one solo cup just for your meal ticket too. The amount of built up trash is disturbing. You would think in 2019 you wouldn't  be seeing such a blatant disregard for the environment. There's plenty of room to have a small dishwasher installed. Will not be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trash

nmYk4_Wp0tTAY0eJMi44bQ.text: So first off I feel it's important to say that this place is in the airport, which I feel colors the review. All in all the place is good for its location. That and the ability to leave an airport eatery with fairly interesting food and a good beer for $15 is pretty good.   The style of the place is a hipster chipotle. Flavor is pretty good and not that inventive. Options are tacos, burritos and bowls w/ the same meat options as chipotle. So why not go to chipotle?  2 reasons, 1. There isn't one and 2. The beer. Again the beer.  So they have 20 different beers on tap, locales and national micro brews. They allow taste before you buy and are pretty good.   3 on its merits, 4 because of an airport.

kxmLI58_llC8rZn1tYXVXQ.text: Delicious fish tacos, quickly prepared and served. Expensive, but that's pretty typical of airport food. Crowded seating area, but I still found a cozy place to eat. If I ever have another layover here I'd be happy to fine here again.

UmEEQEbMkIgvkKf-GdtikA.text: I sat there for 10 min and nothing from the staff. All 5 behind the counter. I finally asked for a menu and what type of non alcoholic beer they had. the manager pull away from his phone and bragging to other customers about how much he works and points to the wall for the menu. Goes back to his phone and tells me no non alcoholic "anything". That was it for helping me. Another 20 min of waiting with no help I went next door to paradise bakery. Having to eat at an airport bar is bad enough without shit service and attitude.

1Ctcm-g0TR0CeFw_3-0TTg.text: One of the staff members at the airport location has a really horrible attitude and approach with customers. We laughed at the ridiculousness of it and choose not to engage and opted for another line. She called me a f*cking stupid b*tch and then told me to move over so she could take another order when I could not move as I was waiting for the person in front of me to move and she was just trying to subvert power over me after I choose not engage. She was still angry and told a manager, that came over for her employees defense (and not an advocate for the business, customer, or even general ETHICAL values), minimized the whole thing and just asked us to move. Needless to say, we left and did not get to try the food for fear of retaliation. The lack of customer service and professionalism is definitely a huge problem. The serious anger/mental health issues of the employee should be a concern to everyone. We couldn't even get in the door and give them our money before their collection of horrible employees showed us we probably shouldn't. At the very least I appreciate that. When people show you who they are, believe them.

gNVHEngZXJ-9S4cZezGWjQ.text: Even if this wasn't airport food, this place would be pretty good.  Think of it as a more expensive chipotle (minus the E. coli).  I got the shredded beef bowl for $10 and was pleasantly surprised.  Also, guac is included, so kudos for that.  Wait time was also shorter than most other airport options.  We were lucky enough to snag a seat, but tables are limited.

idD9fkXJTQqTCzxB42Ietg.text: Really good! Was surprised, with all the big names in the airport like zinc, chelsea's, chevraunt, I wanted something quick. It was quick but wow it was really good! Carnitas & chicken tacos with corn tortillas had great flavor. Even the beans & rice (beans on top of rice) were seasoned perfectly. Kiltlifter on tap I like this place. If I get a chance to come again they may make it to 5 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c7xtQ9LNpmQr6oHUbwicpw.text: I don't have a whole lot of expectations from airport restaurants but serving raw fish would still catch me off guard. The fish was not properly thawed and was tasteless on top of being raw.

Q-k9bEDn9p_AEdoeHdlhDg.text: Weak. I had a layover in the C terminal. I ordered the chips and queso. The chips were stale tasting and often fried together into one big cake. The queso made warmed velveeta seem flavorful. The Scottsdale Blonde was a nice beer. Overall - not a great experience - even for airport food standards.

DyCmgwcfPJpqfZHc3jXGDQ.text: This place is great. Beer is served only in red Solo cups just like a proper dive bar. Build your own burritos, fish tacos. All good. Hey you're in an airport, set expectations accordingly! Love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Day Drinking Headquarters!

BsXvlcimkvheLVuFi_JcfA.text: The 5 stars is solely based on their Bloody Mary. Comes in a red cup and its spicy upon request. Perfect before a flight.

bOxrpb1GEZUZK5NpTxS7Ng.text: 2.0 Stars.  I understand price gouging at airports. But $9.99 for a 6-8 inch burrito? It was tasty, but it was no meal...merely a snack.  I felt robbed. I had a 1 1/2 hour lay over. I should have walked around a little and asked if there was a McDonald's in the airport.  SURE ENOUGH...THERE IS !!!  Don't spend your money here if you are really hungry.

bcTkTmoCxk_mYiJIdi5Waw.text: Worst, slowest service ever. I had limited time to get food before a 2.5 hour flight home, and I ordered a simple quesadilla, waited 15 mins and ended up refunding it to catch my flight. Angry, hungry, annoyed. 6 people working, only 3 cooking with the other 3 standing around...get it together, people, speed matters at airports.

WBRWLvTPkihrudbYEOGNYg.text: just ok food and terrible service....you smile and say hello and thank you and the tattooed ghetto girls here smirk at you......ALL OF THEM.....fourth time here....they are at least consistent at not training their staff...... trying something else next time...

1hR4ixLJwGHgSHYqa59Jzg.text: The restaurant is difficult to get seating and very crowded.   The fish tacos were one of the best I've tasted. It's hard to find good tasting food in airports. The prices are fair given that everything in the airport is pricier.   We got the chicken bacon quesadilla, the chicken bowl, and the hot dog.  The hot dog was exceptional but the other two items were average.   I would highly recommend their fish tacos!

aZCzIv-x68jZ8redV5uOCA.text: $20 for a burrito and draft beer, $10 burrito with no sides and $7 beer. The burrito was pretty big for me, however everything was so bland. I had the carne asada and it was overcooked and dry, I had to add 2 sauces packs and a ton of hot sauce to add flavor. For the pros, it is a cool place to hang out if you have a long layover. Food was quick, friendly people, and tv to watch the game. If I was stuck in the terminal I would try again and order something different. Other people's food at the bar looked good.

KQ-mTYcq_dRlKZ3KyXIACA.text: for a Hispanic themed restaurant it didn't really taste Hispanic. The chicken burrito was ok, reason being is the beans were too dry and the chicken was flavorless yet the rice was surprisingly good. The pre packages salsa was not spicy whatsoever and was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hOlSkFPvC6IjOgU17GtfNg.text: 5 stars for a few reasons. Awesome beer selection and I have 3 hours to kill. The food is well above average airport fare. If you have some time and need a good beer come here. Gate C12. It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar area.

aqmjZcLHg4D_kbwcwAzh8w.text: It's hard to fail at nachos, and I had the blandest nachos I've ever had, despite the beans, cheese, jalapenos, guac, sour cream, and pico de gallo piled on top. I'm not even sure which topping it was that tasted like cardboard because it ALL kinda tasted like variations of paper.   The space is small, and you order and then stand around blocking everybody else while you wait for your number to be called so then you can nudge your way back to the front.   I'm only adding a star because they seemed to have a decent beer variety on tap, although I didn't get any because there was no place to eat inside the premises.

QgkF507ikxvqa-ImHny5gA.text: Good food especially for an airport. Really pleased with Sky Harbor additions of Chelsea's Kitchen and Sauce. But for food next to the gate this is a viable option. Good bacon and egg breakfast tacos as well as chicken tacos for lunch. Give it a try. Cartel coffee next door also.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good tacos !

_fGaxLUNxcLgJf5vgkYeHg.text: can airport food be both expensive AND crappy? sir veza's strives to answer that question, and answer it they do. while at first glance the menu appears promising, assuming you can get past the idea that you're paying 5 dollars for a single beef taco, the delivery unfortunately falls short.   the chips were stale, the tomatoes had that mealy texture of refrigeration, and the chicken was clearly frozen shortly prior to my consumption of it.  while a good guacamole can cover a multitude of sins, this guac did not cover for anyone. it was tasteless.  in short, this is a passable meal for a disappointing (but not surprising) price. i was not expecting greatness, but i was hoping for it. i'll keep hoping somewhere else, i suppose.

T7TkFLU6NyIUxZdEgdjlYA.text: Experience at Sir Veza's on Aug 10th, 2017...a little late on writing this! I eat a Plant-Based Diet and was looking for a bite before my flight. I came across this place and approached to find out what they've got for me. I initially began to order a Bowl, but made some changes (no cheese, etc). Deborah W recognized what I was omitting and with approval from her manager, changed it to "sides" instead, saving me some $ and time altering their menu item. I got black beans/pico/peppers/avocado and corn tortillas. They were delicious! And Deborah was so sweet and patient with the order.

bkRZbSCLT041Zsb-GWHlgQ.text: When your flight has been delayed because too many planes are trying to get into Phoenix for the big game - it's nice to have places to kill some time at and grab a little something to eat too!  This place - at least when I was there - had great staff, the pricing wasn't bad - food tasted great and they were not slow - even though I had time to kill. Seemed clean, but it was just really the same ole same ole. However, I wouldn't hesitate to return!  Perhaps more for a drink than a dinner!

TBgr5TTsa8Jvd00xgFfRjw.text: Worthless piece of crap restrnt around. Staff all have attitude from hell.   Its dirty and food is sparse and marginal.   They advertise 2  tamales for $11.   They are frozen crap served with literally 2 teaspoons of rice and beans.  They charge for xtra sauce. This place is shameful for Sky Harbor Airport.  You are better to wait for peanuts on SWA . Only positive, they give free dink refills.  Just keeping it honest and fair.

gX0qA2pBNogoiAyS5A3mlg.text: I've never disagreed with a Yelp rating so much. Maybe people from Phoenix just have justifiably high standards when it comes to Mexican food. Maybe it's a service thing (although my service was great). Who knows. What I do know is that this place is super tasty and very reasonably priced. I got the chicken burrito for $10 and it's some of the best airport food I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and come in if you have a layover at PHX!

aj6zX3lyu8TfZFnh33wFqQ.text: Do yourself a favor the next time you're in Sky Harbor and get the veggie tacos. I prefer the flour tortillas.   People have to be ordering the wrong thing here! Why only a 3 star rating?? I've eaten meat for 28 years and the vegetarian tacos have got to be some of the best tacos I have ever had, meat or vegetarian.   Personally, the small side of rice and beans isn't anything to get excited about, but the tacos are killer. I travel a lot for work and every time I stop in phoenix, I make a trip over to sir vezas near C12 no matter where I get into or fly out of.   I have a friend in Tucson who was like "meh" when I suggested sir vezas. Once he had the tacos, he was pleasantly surprised and a convert.  You will be too.

EVy365ULDdFH3tkow9eRdw.text: Primarily a drinking place, and even though they have a decent quantity of taps, they don't have very good craft options.  Breakfast was overpriced and very mediocre.  This place plays second fiddle to Los Taquitos in the next row of restaurants over that has much better burritos.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0uLsxmo9mIPzEIUnxc3Ruw.text: Thought I'd grab a bite while waiting for my flight. The good:  counter service was great. The slider buns were fresh. The mediocre:  burger patty didn't look like or taste like beef.  It was mashed down on the flat top it was dry and devoid of any meat juice. The Monterrey jack cheese was no where to be found and the thousand island dressing couldn't help over come the overcooked, dry patty. The fries we cooked in a fryer used to cook seafood.   The bakery next door would have been a better choice.

yeTUMzKssF4NXspregZ0-g.text: The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the food tasted fair. Although, the portion to price was offensive at best. I felt compelled to speak to the manager hoping that there was a mistake. When I she treated me like the fool who just got duped and there wasn't a thing she was about to do about it. Nice managerial skills. Then, while my family was still eating, a server came up to our tiny table and dropped off the condiment bucket that we had removed to accommodate our meals and said "Be sure to put back the condiments when you are done!" She didn't even ask us the cursory, "How's everything?" OFFENSIVE--RIP OFF--RUDE. Save yourself the abuse and go elsewhere. Good luck, descent people.

HAtxzQRlcuFJU6__y00Htw.text: Surprisingly good. Got the taco salad. Was at first disappointed because I only saw lettuce, but once I dug in, got to the crunchy taco shell, nicely grilled chicken pieces (lots of it) and delicious beans and other ingredients. Not a lot of seats though so it was a bit difficult to get comfortable but the food was delicious.

Rkzp2Etr1uQ_pId8QpaXCQ.text: I love this place and look forward to lay overs at Sky Harbor just so I can get some Mini Chimi Bites and then there is the staff, they're great.  Today was no exception. Fallon was super nice and made sure my stop was excellent. Good food, good service and good prices what more could you ask for?

qGOGCLT9geboOkrFBDSDdQ.text: I got the bowl [which comes with guacamole, blak beans, rice, salsa, cilantro, chipotle crema] and for the meats I chose Barbacoa and carnitas. I wasn't expecting much for the quantity, the quality is average. Didn't have much meat in my bowl. If you're looking for airport food that'll satisfy your hunger for an hour or two, get what I got! Good for those who don't want to be on the plane with a full stomach. =]

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bowl [guacamole, black beans, rice, salsa, cilantro, and chipotle crema] with Barbacoa and Carnitas

Mkhyt9nOgQueqFvx2GSccA.text: I stopped in for a bite to eat since I had plenty of time before my flight. I ordered shredded beef tacos, queso and chips, and rice. The rice I could have passed on, it was flavorless and dry but as far as the rest of my meal it was fantastic. The tacos had good spice and were so juicy. Sir Veza's was little too crowded though, I had no place so sit and wait for my food. A little frustrating but I guess a good crowd means good food.

7CNsVdqNomOjwZpmTuPtXA.text: Stopped by on the way to a flight. Place my order and waited several minutes for the to go order. The girl (Destiny) called the number and by the time I got to the window she called final call and continued to argue with me back and forth 4-5 times saying she has called the number 3 times and its was now final. I asked if she had a bag for the to go order and she said yes and set the bag next to the order. I reminded Destiny that typically the customer is always right and she continued to argue then ignore. Discussed with manager and he refunded the money. I still would like to let the customer here beware of the young girl behind the counter. She is rude and I'm sure since its an airport location will go unnoticed by her employer.

2TiGnlfD36drp6WaFW9cNg.text: I needed lunch during a layover. Unfortunately, PHX doesn't have many options. So I settled on this place. The decor was fun and the menu LOOKED good. But it is best not to judge a book by its cover.   First, we ordered the sliders. I was starving but my wife just wanted a snack. Figuring the sliders might be enough to satisfy us both, we ordered them. You get TWO sliders for $8. They were flavorless, but not terrible.  Because that didn't satisfy my hunger, I went back and ordered the nachos. Nachos, how hard could that be? Ok, these were TERRIBLE! The cheese, wasn't cheese. And it didn't even come close to tasting like cheese. The meat certainly didn't look like meat. And the chips weren't very good either. I've never done this before, but I actually returned them. I wasn't about to pay $12 for the 2 terrible bites my wife and I took.   Find another place, you won't be happy eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Phoenix, in Phoenix.

lw_T5iQ--TimNrU4HvxJ3Q.text: As airport for goes really great. Small, wish they had a better seating capacity but the food was spot on and prepared fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nitro Nacho

wOuWSQZ5j4f5bH_z6mwOxg.text: Stopped here for a quick bite prior to my flight. Made my bowl vegan which basically came down to 5 ingredients and boy did they skimp. For the price, and I get it.... The airport is always overpriced, but then you add in the reduction of food choices that comes with the meal and it was like I got half the serving for a full price. Needless to say it was not worth the price at all. The speed however was super quick and seeing the amount of people they were serving food to at once that was pretty impressive.   Well, you live and you learn next time I just have to pack my lunch when flying, just sucks when you're delayed. Maybe they can figure out some kind of balance to make the cost with it.

v7HxEMCEZ07upn-awmNOMQ.text: Reliable food typically overpriced. Don't expect any of the servers to go above and beyond to make you a satisfied customer. If you're good with the minimum work they'll do, definitely stop here to help a rumbling tummy.

DNXCFZTVyXduq6-5EMpmZQ.text: The vegetarian tamales here were excellent. I am a picky tamale critic, having grown up in CA, but this spot fit the bill. The breakfast bowl was pretty tasty, though I guess I was expecting it to be over rice. The tortilla chips were an odd find, but hey, I guess a starch is a starch...sort of. I would've preferred eggs and sour cream etc over rice, but it was still good. Had my flight been delayed any longer I would've gone back for more items from the lunch menu. Service here was fast, even during busy rushes. I'll definitely come back here on my next layover on Southwest. Thanks guys!

5P2AHMfTslK4Qt_ZqAnmDA.text: Not exactly good.    Some where between bad and a low good.   Had the sliders and they were mystery meat.  Tasteless.  The only thing I could taste was the thousand island dressing. I'm always suspicious of a hamburger that is perfectly round.  But the fries we good.

z8m083U3nCnqikWTej9Oaw.text: Worst burrito I've ever had! Stale tortilla, undercooked rice, poorly cooked vegetables, zero seasoning. You give them $9 and they give you something to throw directly in the trash.

11O_dwi9QVbz_8zRk4ZqEw.text: So the fish tacos? FREAKIN' AH-MAZING!  But the communication between the FOH & BOH was basically non-existent.   I'm sure things would run a lot more smoothly if they worked together more.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cag9JCKCyGvulu_BD1W-kA.text: Well damn, over $16 for 8 mini chimi bites, and a beer.  The bites had very little filling, but were otherwise tasty.  Even for being inside the terminal, the price was high.  I only eat in the airport when I'm delayed, as I was this evening.  Might return, but odds aren't high.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chili mini chimi bites

NPQymsd_DAHOwumsm9Kucw.text: For 10 bucks a normal order of fries would be nice. Good thing the airport has a captive audience.

vFyjyXY8VoYBcis5lsdUMQ.text: I'm accustomed to airport food being expensive, but even by that standard this was disappointing for a $14 chopped salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pJ3yi6k4WkHh47VnJHpA7w.text: There are almost no restaurants in this terminal, and this one was right next to my gate. I have been craving chips and queso, so I ordered some. I was very disappointed that it took 20 minutes to get a small take out box of chips and a teeny bit of queso on top. Normally, the cheese is in a small container on the side, especially in an establishment like an airport, but they didn't care when I said I'd rather have it on the side. They were very rude when I complained that I didn't have enough queso for the amount of chips I got, and they continued to said it would be another $5 for more queso! The price was already outrageous so I couldn't justify it. I ate 1/4 of my dish and had to throw out the rest of the overly fried chips. One star only because of the convenience of being next to my gate. Otherwise the customer service is horrible- the ladies look at you like you're bothering them, and roll their eyes when you ask for some napkins! Like it's such an inconvenience. I will not return when I come back to this airport, that's for sure!

dtESoXRCmENjhx6qmQOXqw.text: I was stuck in the Phoenix International Airport for 2.5 hours longer than expected during a flight delay one Saturday evening and was getting hungry. After walking around checking out all the different restaurants in the terminal I finally found Sir Vesas.  There aren't too many good places to eat in this airport (but plenty of average ones) so I chose Sir Vesas for the three star average and their more than one Vegetarian Option. I ordered the Bean and Cheese Burrito and it was about $7 which isn't too expensive for airport food. The burrito was pretty good. Black beans, cheese, sour cream and salsa inside a flour tortilla. Nothing bad, nothing great. Just ok.  I might come back to Sir Vesas again if I was in the same terminal at Phoenix International. I wouldn't traverse multiple terminals to get here, but if I was there then it's not a bad option. They have a nice bar area as well as a small seating area which makes for a nice place to relax if you can find a spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside of Bean Burrito
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bean Burrito
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar and Restaurant

6YASiJIE0RGoiS4f125Tiw.text: The taco salad was awful. Refried beans looked like they came straight out of the can, not heated. Couldn't tell if beef was ground chunks or pieces and no salsa.... Slider burgers were all filler.  Panera has got to be better if you have to stand with your food.

GvGYrFsjnc5Py5DNGaAx3g.text: Whoever designed this place should be institutionalized. Every space is so narrow that a single person blocks it off, let alone when they're dragging along children with their own bags. There's so few surfaces on which you can lay down your meal that people were literally eating over garbage cans. I had to sit there and wait, being pushed and bumped around like a buoy, as the stench of putrefying tacos wafted out of everywhere.  The salad, much to my surprise, had potential. The combination of ingredients was great, but completely spoiled by a dressing that tasted like a melted lemon-lime popsicle.

h6jm3fJMUcYy9cfL2zkdGw.text: I went to this restaurant today with a group of my work friends and the employees at this restaurant were so beyond rude and inconsiderate. We all grouped around a table and the time we spent there they were giving us dirty looks and cursing behind our backs. Instead of coming to us to address the "problem" of us sitting at a table that was "broken" they gave us dirty looks and made us feel stupid. I would NOT recommend coming here, they are horrible employees and I hope you don't have to experience their crude and horrible attitudes.

1v28qCf0MOm8lZB3Kf1n_g.text: Debra Is the best. Great food and very kind, efficient service on a busy Thanksgiving weekend.

miBhvabx83HSDkMGTdDHPw.text: Beverages are only offered in plastic cups! This is such an immense contribution to the plastic pollution problem. In an establishment that does not offer beers "to go", there is no excuse not to use glass.

9EQ_veBd-bubgsPEKMYpGg.text: I stopped in while waiting for a flight.  Initially it was packed but luckily everyone's flight must have been leaving at the same time and cleared out in time for me to get a seat at the bar.  I ordered the chicken burrito bowl which consists of black beans, sv rice, queso casero, bowls guacamole, roasted corn, pico salsa.  Very tasty, light enough that I didn't feel sleepy after I ate it.  They serve mixed drinks in the "red" cup that you see at most parties, just to give you that additional "garage" theme feel.  Bill aka Preston is a funny and well engaging bartender!  They should give this guy a raise!  So quick, thorough and attentive I love it!

5uXMdoAclto_7NnNEhtOvg.text: This was a lovely surprise in the world of airport food. We ordered one order of Carne Asada Tacos and one order of Fish Tacos. Both were very flavorful and seasoned well. Tacos seem to be one of those things that all restaurants think they can do, but this place really can make a good taco. My husband and I agreed that the fish tacos were our favorite of the two. Pricing seemed reasonable, especially for an airport location and our order came up without a long wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada Tacos
Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Tacos

LyqGXOkBB6b4QgI3M6CvyA.text: I ordered: -two beef Tomales - their *world famous* sirnoran dog(which I had a feeling was a marketing ploy) -and a pumpkin tomale (we were lucky to get this seasonal item).  The beef Tomales were sub pare, the flavor just wasn't there in a the masa. The sirnoran dog was a let down the flavors didn't work, the old school fries that came with it tasted like they were in the freezer for to long, the pepper was good though. The pumpkin tomale was a steamed pumpkin pie filling in masa wi th whipped cream, it turned out to be pretty good and was the only saving grace.  Don't think I'll  eat here agian.

mp-t1CwfCKrfx3Eh7T3fCw.text: Although the chicken bowl I ordered had decent flavor, the chicken was absolutely dry, which kind of stinks. I feel like the price you pay is based on the meat, and if the meat is yucky, you just paid for pretty much nothing. Plus, they give you a little packet of salsa in a little plastic container like BBQ sauce from a fast food restaurant. That's when you know it's not good, fresh salsa, and you probably shouldn't open it unless you're desperate. I left mine in the bag. The price is rather high for what you get, which many reviews on here state. I should've read reviews prior to ordering, but it was enough food for me at that moment in time. I don't know when I'll be in Phoenix again, but I highly doubt I'd be going back to this place if I do.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Bowl...

mi4piXE_1VYODskEIxWyGw.text: Was connecting in PHX and tried this place out because there was nothing else there. Got a chicken bowl and was pretty disappointed. Chicken had tons of fat on it and was very bland on it. Rest of the bowl was okay but still not something I would try again.

1pRg4e5i9Q1DUaSGnNsBwg.text: Single. Use. Plastics. Unless you're at a keg party, this is not a good way to serve beer. The food is adequate.

yfdlL50NTeqBmdn144oysA.text: Sky Harbor is the best airport I have been to in terms of food. With quality offerings like Four Peaks, Humble Pie and La Grande Orange you have some great choice. I am adding another great little spot for your consideration with Sir Veza's. Tacos, burritos, salads and even burgers are on the menu. I ordered two chicken tacos with a side of black beans and rice. The tacos come wrapped in two soft corn tortillas (they also offer flour), grilled chicken topped with a chipotle crema, cilantro,  queso fresco, and fajita veggies. The crema had heat and made their salsa toppings irrelevant. The tacos are big so please don't be scared of the high price tag, you will be full. They are very generous with the protein and if you can find a seat in the crowded dining room you are all set.

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicke taco with rice and beans and salsa

KUDWXNt9Chyol4d5ZuStqw.text: This trip to Sky Harbor Airport Term 4 included a visit to Sir Veza's.  Food Average - not bad, not memorable.  Atmosphere Cool, rustic antique-looking stuff  surrounds the dining area.  I wouldn't walk across the concourse to eat here, but it wasn't terrible.  Good thing they have a captive flow of hungry diners waiting for flights to airports near and far

__t7nC79_sUZYYt7ICB3dA.text: Great chicken bacon quesadillas.  Tortillas are insanely good.   Staff is friendly and good atmosphere for a airport

photos.caption: Photo of Sir Veza's Taco Garage - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great bartender and server
